178.description: Specifies that University of Florida Board of Trustees shall lease Shands Teaching Hospital & Clinics on Gainesville campus to Shands Teaching Hospital & Clinics, Inc.; provides that Shands Jacksonville Medical Center, Inc., & its parent, Shands Jacksonville HealthCare, Inc., are private not-for-profit corporations organized primarily to support health affairs mission of University of Florida Board of Trustees; provides requirements for lease, contract, or agreement between board of trustees & corporations, etc.

180.title: Infrastructure Investment
180.description: Requires Secretary of Transportation to designate certain duties to assistant secretary; revises requirements for Florida Seaport Mission Plan; requires Florida Seaport Transportation & Economic Development Council to develop priority list of projects & submit list to DOT; requires ports to develop strategic plans, to be consistent with local government comprehensive plans & submitted to council; revises principles of Florida Transportation Plan; includes facilities in Strategic Intermodal System & Emerging Strategic Intermodal System, etc.

181.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
181.title: Public Broadcasting Program System
181.description: Includes certain television stations licensed by FCC for which support & funding may be given.

182.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
182.title: Traffic Offenses
182.description: Provides penalties for person who commits moving violation that causes serious bodily injury to, or causes or contributes to death of, person operating or riding in motor vehicle or operating or riding on motorcycle.

183.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 926 (Ch.
183.title: Employment Liability for Persons with Disabilities
183.description: Designates act "Employees with Disabilities Opportunity Act"; limits liability of employers of persons with developmental disabilities for acts or omissions of such employees in certain circumstances; provides that not-for-profit supported employment service provider who has provided supported employment services to individual with disability is not liable for actions or conduct of that individual occurring within scope of his or her employment; provides applicability.

184.title: Residential Building Permits
184.description: Prohibits local enforcing agencies & building code officials or entities from requiring certain inspections of buildings, structures, or real property as condition of issuance of certain residential building permits; provides for application; provides for conditional repeal.

185.title: Pub. Rec./Intelligence/Investigative Information
185.description: Expands exemption from public records requirements for criminal intelligence information & criminal investigative information to include photographs, videotapes, or images of any part of body of victim of sexual offense of video voyeurism; provides review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

186.title: Pub. Rec./Photos and Recordings/Killing of Person
186.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for photographs & video & audio recordings that depict or record killing of person; authorizes access to such photographs or video or audio recordings by specified members of immediate family of deceased subject of photographs or video or audio recordings; provides for access to such records by local governmental entities or state or federal agencies in furtherance of official duties; provides for access pursuant to court order, etc.

187.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
187.title: Public Accountancy
187.description: Authorizes Board of Accountancy to establish peer review oversight committee; revises licensure renewal requirements for firms engaged in certain aspects of public accounting; requires such firms to enroll in peer review programs & undergo peer reviews; requires firms that fail specified number of peer reviews to submit certain documentation to board; requires board to establish minimum standards for peer review programs; provides for approval of peer review administering organizations, etc.

189.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
189.title: Public School Educational Instruction
189.description: Requires district school boards to designate one month of school year to celebrate Founding Fathers of United States of America & principles inherent in country's founding documents; specifies focus of instruction during designated month; provides that instruction may be integrated into existing school curriculum.

190.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
190.title: Required Instruction in the Public Schools
190.description: Revises curriculum of character-development program required in kindergarten through grade 12.

191.title: Exemptions to Water Management Requirements
191.description: Revises exemption for agricultural-related activities to include certain impacts to surface waters & wetlands, clarifies purpose of such activities, & limits applicability of exemption; provides for retroactive application of exemption; provides exclusive authority to DACS to determine whether certain activities qualify for agricultural-related exemption under specified conditions; requires memorandum of agreement between DACS & water management districts, etc.

192.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 650 (Ch.
192.title: Mobile Home Park Lot Tenancies
192.description: Provides for citation of responsible party for violation of local code or ordinance; prohibits liens, penalties, fines, or other administrative or civil proceedings against one party or that party's property for duty or responsibility of other party; revises provisions relating to grounds & proceedings for eviction; revises procedures for mobile home owners being provided eviction notice due to change in use of land comprising mobile home park or portion thereof from which mobile homes are to be evicted, etc.

193.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
193.title: Driving Without a Valid License
193.description: Provides for immobilization or impoundment of motor vehicle driven or owned by person charged with driving without driver's license or while person's driver's license or privilege to drive is canceled, suspended, or revoked.

194.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
194.title: Preference in Award of State Contracts
194.description: Expands provisions that authorize agency, county, municipality, school district, or other political subdivision of state to provide preferential consideration to Florida business in awarding competitively bid contracts to purchase personal property to include purchase of construction services; provides that for specified competitive solicitations authority to grant preference supersedes any local ordinance or regulation which grants preference to specified vendors, etc.

195.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
195.title: Health Education
195.description: Provides for mandatory one-half credit in health education, independent of physical education credit requirement, for high school students; provides waiver for students who request to take & successfully complete health education assessment developed by DOE; reduces number of credits in elective courses.

196.title: Driver's Licenses and Identification Cards
196.description: Requires application form for original, renewal, or replacement driver's license or identification card shall include option to make voluntary contribution to Disabled American Veterans, Department of Florida; provides that such contributions are not income of revenue nature.

197.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
197.title: Ocean Lifeguards
197.description: Defines "ocean lifeguard"; provides enhanced penalties for assault or battery on ocean lifeguard; revises provisions relating to arrest without warrant; conforms provisions.

198.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
198.title: Excuse from Jury Service
198.description: Expands parental eligibility to be excused from jury service; includes practicing psychologists in list of persons judge is authorized to excuse from jury service.

199.title: Motor Vehicle Licenses
199.description: Redefines term "line-make vehicles" to clarify circumstances under which vehicles sold or leased under multiple brand names or marks constitute single line-make; revises application of provisions relating to franchise agreements.

200.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 444 (Ch.
200.title: Scrutinized Companies
200.description: Prohibits state agency or local governmental entity from contracting for goods & services of more than certain amount with company on Scrutinized Companies with Activities in Sudan List or Scrutinized Companies with Activities in Iran Petroleum Energy Sector List; requires contract provision that allows for termination of contract if company is found to have submitted false certification or to have been placed on such list; provides exceptions, etc.

201.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 170 (Ch.
201.title: Electronic Filing & Receipt/Court & Legal Document
201.description: Requires each state attorney & public defender to electronically file court documents with clerk of court & receive court documents from clerk of court; defines term "court documents"; requires report on progress made to use Florida Courts E-Portal system or clerks' offices portals; provides for electronic procedures for filing documents & resolving disputes in workers' compensation proceedings; requires response to petition for workers' compensation benefits to be filed electronically, etc.

202.title: Wellness or Health Improvement Programs
202.description: Authorizes insurers & HMOs to offer voluntary wellness or health improvement program & encourage or reward participation in program by offering rewards or incentives to members; authorizes insurers & HMOs to require plan members not participating in said programs to provide verification that their medical condition warrants nonparticipation in order for nonparticipants to receive rewards or incentives; requires that reward or incentive be disclosed in policy or certificate, etc.

203.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
203.title: Green Job Creation
203.description: Provides definitions & definitional criteria that qualify jobs for green job corporate tax credits; provides tax credits against corporate income tax for creation of qualifying green jobs; specifies amount of tax credit allowed for each green job created & maximum number of jobs for which taxpayer may claim credit; limits availability of green job tax credits to specified period of tax years; provides for carryover of tax credit; restricts taxpayer from taking more than one tax credit for same job under certain circumstances, etc.

204.title: Criminal Justice
204.description: Designates act "Jim King Keep Florida Working Act"; provides legislative intent; requires state agencies to prepare reports that identify & evaluate restrictions on licensing & employment for ex-offenders; prohibits state agencies from denying application for license, permit, certificate, or employment based solely on person's lack of civil rights; provides exception.

205.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
205.title: Commercial Parasailing
205.description: Creates "Alejandra White Act"; provides requirements for persons conducting commercial parasailing operations; requires annual license from FWCC; requires liability insurance.

206.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
206.title: Environmental Surcharge on Bottled Water
206.description: Establishes surcharge on bottled water sold at retail in this state; provides exception; requires that moneys collected from surcharge be deposited into Ecosystem Management and Restoration Trust Fund.

207.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
207.title: Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement
207.description: Revises definitions; specifies certain facilities that are exempt from transient rentals tax; deletes application of brackets for calculation of sales & use taxes; revises criteria establishing circumstances under which taxes on sale of prepaid calling arrangements are due; deletes application of brackets for calculation of sales & use taxes; limits $5,000 cap on discretionary sales surtax to sale of motor vehicles, aircraft, boats, manufactured homes, modular homes, & mobile homes, etc.

208.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
208.title: Fertilizer
208.description: Revises legislative findings relating to implementation of Model Ordinance for Florida-Friendly Fertilizer Use on Urban Landscapes; updates reference to version of model ordinance; revises authority of county & municipal governments to adopt fertilizer standards that are in addition to or more stringent than standards of model ordinance; requires county & municipal governments to report adoption of such standards to DEP; provides for applicability of specified provisions, etc.

209.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
209.title: Self-Service Storage Facilities
209.description: Revises definition of term "last known address"; revises notice requirements relating to enforcing owner's lien; authorizes notice by first-class mail, along with certificate of mailing; revises provisions relating to when notice given is presumed delivered; specifies nonapplication of certain provisions to right to create contractual liens & limitations on value of property; requires rental agreements & applications for rental agreements to contain provision for disclosure of applicant's membership in uniformed services, etc.

210.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
210.title: Tax on Sales, Use, and Other Transactions
210.description: Specifies period during which sales of firearms are exempt from such tax; authorizes DOR to adopt rules.

211.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
211.title: Public Employment
211.description: Provides that public employer may not use application that inquires about applicant's arrests or convictions or otherwise inquire into or consider criminal record or criminal history of applicant for employment until applicant has been selected for interview; provides exceptions; provides that employer may notify applicants of policies concerning disqualification from employment for applicants with particular criminal history backgrounds.

212.title: Florida Veterans' Hall of Fame
212.description: Establishes Florida Veterans' Hall of Fame; provides for administration by DVA; designates location; provides procedures for nomination, selection, & induction.

213.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
213.title: Entities Contracting with the Medicaid Program
213.description: Exempts certain entities providing services solely to Medicaid recipients under Medicaid contract from being subject to premium tax imposed on premiums, contributions, & assessments received by prepaid limited health service organizations; provides for prospective operation; specifies that act does not provide basis for relief from or assessment of taxes not paid, or for determining any denial of or right to refund of taxes paid, prior to effective date.

214.title: Individual Retirement Accounts
214.description: Clarifies exemption of inherited individual retirement accounts from legal processes; provides intent; provides for retroactive application.

215.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 702 (Ch.
215.title: Umbilical Cord Blood Banking
215.description: Requires DOH to post on its website certain resources & link to specified materials regarding umbilical cord blood banking & to encourage health care providers to provide their pregnant patients with umbilical cord blood banking information; provides that health care provider or health care facility & its employees or agents are not liable for damages in civil action, subject to prosecution in criminal proceeding, or subject to disciplinary action by appropriate regulatory board for acting in good faith to comply with act.

216.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
216.title: Corporate License Plates
216.description: Provides for DHSMV to create Corporate License Plate Program; requires that specified minimum fees be paid by applicants & corporate sponsors for such applications; requires that corporate sponsor meet specified eligibility requirements.

217.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
217.title: Corporate Income Tax Credits
217.description: Establishes Florida Public School Tax Credit Program; provides for credits against corporate income tax for contributions to public schools for specified purposes; authorizes public schools to determine how to use undesignated contributions; requires public schools to report specified information to DOR; limits total annual amount of credits; requires department to apportion dollar amount of tax credits to each school board receiving eligible contributions, etc.

218.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
218.title: Human Trafficking
218.description: Specifies documents that must be possessed by each person providing or offering to provide massage services in certain circumstances; requires presentation of such documents upon request of law enforcement officer; requires operators of massage establishments to maintain valid work authorization documents on premises for each employee who is not U.S. citizen; requires presentation of such documents upon request of law enforcement officer, etc.

219.title: Medical Malpractice
219.description: Requires DOH to issue expert witness certificates to certain physicians & dentists licensed outside of state; provides application & certification requirements & exemptions for physicians & dentists issued certifications from certain licensure & fee requirements; provides additional grounds for disciplinary actions; requires Board of Medicine & Board of Osteopathic Medicine to adopt certain patient forms specifying cataract surgery risks; provides for execution & admissibility of patient forms in civil & administrative proceedings, etc.

220.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
220.title: Student Safety
220.description: Requires district school board policies to list emergency response agencies that are responsible for notifying school district of emergencies; requires emergency response agencies to notify private schools in school district under certain circumstances.

221.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
221.title: Practice of Dentistry
221.description: Requires persons who apply for licensure renewal as dentist or dental hygienist to furnish certain information to DOH in dental workforce survey; requires department to serve as coordinating body for purpose of collecting, disseminating, & updating dental workforce data; requires department to maintain database regarding state's dental workforce; authorizes certain business entities to pay for prescription drugs obtained by practitioners licensed under ch. 466, F.S., etc.

222.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
222.title: Pub. Rec./Dental Workforce Surveys
222.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for information contained in dental workforce surveys submitted by dentists or dental hygienists to DOH as condition for license renewal; provides exceptions; provides for future legislative review & repeal; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

223.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
223.title: Dextromethorphan
223.description: Prohibits obtaining or delivering to individual in retail sale any nonprescription compound, mixture, or preparation containing dextromethorphan or related compounds in excess of specified amounts; regulates retail display of products containing dextromethorphan or related compounds; requires training of retail employees; requires person who purchases or otherwise acquires nonprescription compound, mixture, or preparation containing any detectable quantity of dextromethorphan or related compounds to meet specified requirements, etc.

225.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
225.title: Alzheimer's Disease
225.description: Directs DEA to develop & implement public education program relating to screening for Alzheimer's disease within existing resources of department; provides criteria for awarding grants; provides that implementation of memory-impairment screening grant program is contingent upon appropriation of state funds or availability of private resources; specifies types of facilities where employee or direct caregiver providing care for persons with Alzheimer's disease may begin employment without repeating certain training requirements, etc.

226.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
226.title: Tax on Sales, Use, & Other Transactions
226.description: Provides definitions relating to tourist development tax & tourist impact tax, transient rentals tax & convention development tax, & municipal resort tax; provides separate statement of tax requirements on various documents; revises requirements for charging, collecting, & remitting such taxes; authorizes DOR to compensate county governments for providing specified information; specifies payment amount; provides definitions relating to municipal resort tax; provides separate statement of tax requirements; provides exception; provides construction.

227.title: Emergency Fire Rescue Services & Facilities Surtax
227.description: Revises & limits authorized uses for which proceeds from emergency fire rescue services & facilities surtax may be expended; requires that any review required by ordinance or local agreement to determine continued need for imposition of surtax begin within certain time after imposition of surtax or completion of prior review.

228.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
228.title: Pharmacy
228.description: Prohibits ownership, operation, maintenance, opening, establishment, conduct, or having charge of pharmacy at locations within specified radius of certain pain-management clinics; prohibits dispensing practitioners who own, operate, or are employed by certain pain-management clinics from dispensing at certain locations specified controlled substances prescribed for patients at such clinics; provides penalties.

229.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
229.title: Concealed Weapons or Firearms
229.description: Provides that otherwise qualified members & veterans of U.S. Armed Forces be issued concealed weapon or firearm license regardless of age or U.S. residency in certain circumstances; provides additional methods for taking of fingerprints from such license applicants.

230.title: Choose Life License Plates
230.description: Provides for annual use fees to be distributed to Choose Life, Inc., rather than counties; provides for Choose Life, Inc., to redistribute portion of such funds to nongovernmental, not-for-profit agencies that assist certain pregnant women; authorizes Choose Life, Inc., to use portion of funds to administer & promote Choose Life license plate program.

231.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
231.title: Reduction & Future Repeal/Corporate Income Tax
231.description: Provides for incremental reduction of corporate income tax & for its future repeal; provides legislative findings & intent & provides for application; provides for future application to franchise tax of specified parts & sections of ch. 220 as those parts & sections existed before their repeal; provides direction to Division of Statutory Revision to assist legislative committee staff in preparation of conforming legislation for submission to specified future regular sessions.

232.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
232.title: Health Care Coverage
232.description: Requires health insurers, corporations, & health maintenance organizations issuing certain health policies to provide coverage for telemedicine services; provides definitions; prohibits exclusion of telemedicine cost coverage solely because services were not provided face to face; specifies conditions under which insurer, corporation, or health maintenance organization must reimburse telemedicine provider for certain fees & costs; authorizes provisions requiring a deductible, copayment, or coinsurance requirement for telemedicine services, etc.

235.last_action: Withdrawn from Community and Military Affairs Subcommittee; Finance and Tax Committee; Economic Affairs Committee
235.title: Tax Discounts
235.description: Increases discount rate for early tax payments made within specified time after mailing of original tax notice; eliminates discounts for early tax payments made after specified time; increases discount rate for tax payments made within specified time after mailing of tax notice resulting from action of value adjustment board.

236.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 664 (Ch.
236.title: Missing Adults
236.description: Revises definition of term "missing endangered person" to include missing adult who meets criteria for activation of Silver Alert Plan; provides immunity from civil liability for certain persons providing Silver Alert information pertaining to missing adult in good faith; provides that only law enforcement agency having jurisdiction over case may request that clearinghouse activate state Silver Alert.

237.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
237.title: Driver's Licenses
237.description: Creates "Mature Drivers Act"; revises age requirements for issuance of driver's licenses & learner's driver's licenses.

238.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 234 (Ch.
238.title: Firearms
238.description: Provides that person in compliance with terms of concealed carry license may openly carry handgun notwithstanding specified provisions; allows Division of Licensing of DACS to take fingerprints from concealed carry license applicants; provides that person may not openly carry handgun or carry concealed weapon or firearm into specified locations; provides that concealed carry licensees shall not be prohibited from carrying or storing firearm in vehicle for lawful purposes, etc.

239.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
239.title: Voluntary Prekindergarten Education Program
239.description: Provides that prekindergarten instructors in school-year prekindergarten programs delivered by private providers & public schools must meet new professional credentialing requirements beginning July 1, 2014; deletes provisions relating to alternate educational credentials; repeals aspirational goals for professional credentials of prekindergarten instructors.

240.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
240.title: Gasparilla Island Bridge Auth./Lee & Charlotte Co.
240.description: Renames Gasparilla Island Bridge Authority; provides that district is independent special district; revises vote requirements for election of voting members of board of supervisors; revises district's financial year.

242.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
242.title: Health Benefit Plans
242.description: Requires health benefit plans to authorize licensed pharmacists & permitted pharmacies to serve as participating pharmacy services providers for any of plan's participants.

243.title: Lee County Sheriff's Office
243.description: Provides that certain retirement health insurance benefits shall not be available to specified employees.

244.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
244.title: Residential/Nonhomestead Real Property Assessment
244.description: Limits review of changes to assessed or taxable value of real property resulting from certain informal conferences to review by DOR; prohibits adding value of certain improvements to assessed value of certain real property; provides limitation on assessed value of certain real property; provides application; provides procedural requirements & limitations; requires nonrefundable filing fee; specifies additional exceptions to assessments of nonhomestead property at just value, etc.

245.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
245.title: Assault or Battery
245.description: Provides for reclassification of specified assault or battery offenses when committed against persons licensed, registered, certified, or regulated under provisions relating to psychological & clinical, counseling, & psychotherapy services practicing their professions.

246.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
246.title: Hurricane Loss Mitigation Program
246.description: Extends repeal date for Hurricane Loss Mitigation Program; deletes obsolete provision relating to use of funds for programs to retrofit certain existing facilities.

247.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
247.title: Paternity
247.description: Provides purposes of provisions relating to paternity; adds & revises definitions; provides for service of notice of petition for dependency or termination of parental rights; specifies requirements for such notice; specifies conditions under which unmarried biological father may not contest petition for dependency or termination of parental rights, unless court orders otherwise; eliminates defense of lack of notice for such fathers who are not identified after specified inquiry, etc.

248.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
248.title: Employment of Children in Entertainment Industry
248.description: Provides requirements for employment of children in entertainment industry; provides responsibilities of employers & parents or legal guardians of such children; requires preauthorization certificate for each child; provides duties of Division of Regulation within DBPR; provides limitations on working hours of child performers; provides certification requirements & duties of teachers & trainers of child performers, etc.

249.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
249.title: Mentally Deficient and Mentally Ill Defendants
249.description: Defines term "traumatic brain injury"; revises definition of term "mental illness."

250.last_action: Withdrawn from HHS Quality Subcommittee; Business and Consumer Affairs Subcommittee; Health Care Appropriations Subcommittee; Health and Human Services Committee
250.title: Eye Care Professionals
250.description: Revises membership requirements for Board of Optometry; revises duties of, & restrictions on practice of optometry by, nonlicensed supportive personnel; revises list of prohibited acts relating to practice of optometry; prohibits board from adopting rules that prohibit certain acts; revises requirements for applicants seeking to take optician licensure examination; revises grounds that constitute unlawful conduct by opticians.

251.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
251.title: Copy Machines/Photocopiers/Fax Machines/Printers
251.description: Requires vendors of copy machines to provide specified warning labels & information with machines; requires rulemaking; requires vendors of copy machines to erase or otherwise render non-recreatable any records stored in memory of copy machine; provides requirements for financial institutions concerning copy machines; prohibits specified acts concerning required warning labels; provides for recovery of punitive damages for certain violations.

252.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 330 (Ch.
252.title: Violations of the Florida Election Code
252.description: Provides that it is violation of Florida Election Code for candidate to falsely represent military service; permits any person to file complaint with Florida Election Commission; provides for adoption of rules for expedited hearing proceedings; requires assessment of civil penalty for candidate found to have misrepresented military service.

253.title: Indian River Mosquito Control District
253.description: Revises powers of board of commissioners relating to employment of certain persons; specifies provisions of law governing election of commissioners & removes obsolete provisions for staggering of initial terms; requires district to pay for surety bonds required of commissioners before they assume office; requires commissioners to elect secretary/treasurer for board; revises per diem & travel expense provisions for commissioners & employees, etc.

254.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
254.title: Voter Information Cards
254.description: Requires that voter information cards contain address of polling place of registered voter; requires supervisor of elections to issue new voter information card upon change in address of legal residence or change in polling place address; provides instructions for implementation by supervisors of elections.

255.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
255.title: Sudden Unexpected Infant Death
255.description: Creates "Stillbirth and SUID Education and Awareness Act"; requires State Surgeon General to implement public health awareness & education campaign in order to provide information that is focused on decreasing risk factors for sudden unexpected infant death & sudden unexplained death in childhood; specifies duties of State Surgeon General related to maternal & child health programs; requires State Surgeon General to establish task force.

256.title: Injunctions for Protection Against Violence
256.description: Directs Florida Association of Court Clerks & Comptrollers, subject to available funding, to develop automated process by which petitioner for injunction for protection may request notification of service of injunction or notice of other court actions related to injunction; requires that notice be given to petitioner within specified time; provides for content of notice; authorizes association to apply for grants to fund development of automated process.

257.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
257.title: Public School Funding
257.description: Requires OPPAGA to conduct study to determine minimum per-student funding to meet constitutional requirements; requires report to Legislature.

258.title: Judgment Interest
258.description: Requires annual adjustments to rate of interest payable on judgments; provides exceptions; revises calculation of interest rate.

259.last_action: Withdrawn from Transportation and Highway Safety Subcommittee; Transportation and Economic Development Appropriations Subcommittee; Economic Affairs Committee
259.title: Fire-fighting Equipment
259.description: Exempts firefighting equipment from certain motor vehicle size & weight restrictions.

260.title: Restaurants Licensed to Sell Wine on the Premises
260.description: Revises requirements for restaurant patron to remove resealed wine container from restaurant for off-premise consumption.

261.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 844 (Ch.
261.title: Violations of Probation or Community Control
261.description: Designates act "Officer Andrew Widman Act"; authorizes judge, after making certain finding, to issue warrant for arrest of probationer or offender who has violated terms of probation or community control; requires that court inform probationer or offender of violation; authorizes court to commit or release probationer or offender; authorizes court, in determining whether to require or set amount of bail, to consider likelihood that person will be imprisoned for violation of probation or community control.

262.title: Pub. Rec./Regional Autism Centers
262.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for all records that relate to client of regional autism center who receives services of center or participates in center activities & client's family; provides for release of specified confidential & exempt information by center under certain circumstances; provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying information of donor or prospective donor to regional autism center if such donor or prospective donor wishes to remain anonymous, etc.

263.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
263.title: Forensic Services
263.description: Provides legislative intent that forensic services be provided to person charged with misdemeanor as well as felony offense; conforms provisions.

266.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
266.title: Department of Health
266.description: Redefines "food service establishment" to include child care facilities; places regulation of such facilities under jurisdiction of DOH; requires that department consult with specified agencies & not duplicate areas of inspection executed by such agencies.

267.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
267.title: Emergency Medical Services
267.description: Provides requirements for applicant for advanced life support nontransportation licensure; permits municipal, independent special district, & community development district fire departments to provide certain life support services; authorizes county governing body to adopt ordinances establishing standards for issuing certificate of public convenience & necessity; provides conditions for issuance of temporary certificate of public convenience & necessity.

268.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
268.title: Aviation Fuel Tax
268.description: Designates act "Capital City Aviation Fuel Tax Act"; authorizes refund of aviation fuel tax collected on aviation fuel purchased by commercial airlines in state capital meeting specified criteria; provides for application of refund administration procedures; prohibits application in any other municipality; prohibits implementation from reducing or adversely affecting aviation grants.

269.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
269.title: Sexual Performance by a Child
269.description: Defines term "intentionally view"; prohibits controlling or intentionally viewing any photograph, motion picture, exhibition, show, representation, image, data, computer depiction, or other presentation that includes sexual conduct by child; provides exceptions.

270.title: Pub. Rec./Agency Emergency Notification Info.
270.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for information furnished by person to agency for purpose of being provided with emergency notification by agency; provides for retroactive effect of exemption; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

271.title: Corporations Not For Profit
271.description: Provides requirements for management of funds held by institution exclusively for charitable purposes; provides standards of conduct in managing & investing institutional funds; provides requirements for appropriation for expenditure or accumulation of endowment fund; authorizes institution to delegate certain activities to external agent & to release or modify certain restrictions on institutional fund; provides for application to existing or newly established institutional funds; provides relationship to federal law, etc.

273.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
273.title: Design Professionals
273.description: Limits liability for engineers, surveyors & mappers, architects, interior designers, & registered landscape architects as result of construction defects resulting from performance of contract; provides that, if contract requires professional liability insurance, contract may not limit liability of design professional in manner that is inconsistent with insurance requirements; provides exceptions to limitation of liability for design professionals, etc.

274.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
274.title: Electrical Contracting
274.description: Revises authority of municipalities & counties to require that certain electrical journeyman be present on certain industrial or commercial construction sites.

275.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
275.title: Department of Juvenile Justice Education Programs
275.description: Provides that adult education GED test preparation courses & adult education career education courses may be offered to certain high school level students served in department programs.

276.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
276.title: Domestic Wastewater Discharged/Ocean Outfalls
276.description: Postpones dates by which domestic wastewater facilities must meet more stringent treatment & management requirements; revises definition of "functioning reuse system" & changes term "facility's actual flow on an annual basis" to "baseline flow"; revises plan requirements for elimination of ocean outfalls; authorizes certain utilities to enter into binding agreements to share or transfer responsibility for meeting reuse requirements, etc.

278.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
278.title: Sale/Lease/County, District, or Municipal Hospital
278.description: Provides duties of circuit court for sale or lease of county, district, or municipal hospital unless certain exemption or referendum approval applies; provides duties of hospital governing board in evaluating potential purchasers or lessees; requires board to receive approval from circuit court before entering into contract for sale or lease of hospital; allows opponents of sale or lease to submit explanation to hospital governing board; requires publication of notice regarding sale or lease of hospital, etc.

279.title: Child Custody
279.description: Provides that parent's activation, deployment, or temporary assignment to military service & resultant temporary disruption to child may not be sole factor in granting petition for or modification of permanent time-sharing & parental responsibility.

280.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
280.title: Emergency Health Care Providers
280.description: Provides legislative findings & intent; provides that certain emergency health care providers are agents of state for purposes of sovereign immunity when acting pursuant to specified statutory obligations; requires certain indemnity for state from providers.

281.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
281.title: Public Food Service Establishments
281.description: Requires public food service establishments to serve sugar-free substitutes for certain syrups & fruit preserves & provide notice to guests of availability of such sugar-free substitutes; provides requirements for such notice.

282.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
282.title: Background Screening Requirements/School Districts
282.description: Requires Department of Agriculture & Consumer Services to conduct background screening & issue valid statewide certificates to certain noninstructional school district employees or contractual personnel; provides requirements for certificate eligibility & display; provides for payment of certain costs associated with certification; requires department to periodically check for disqualification of certificateholder.

283.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
283.title: Charter Schools
283.description: Provides requirement for composition of charter school governing body; provides for shared use of facilities by charter schools; provides requirements for transfer of enrolled students to certain charter schools; provides conditions that render charter school ineligible for state implementation grant funds; provides capacity restrictions.

284.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
284.title: Chiropractic Medicine
284.description: Revises requirements for obtaining chiropractic medicine faculty certificate; prohibits approval of certain courses for use in continuing chiropractic education; revises provisions relating to indirect supervision of & duration of education & training program for certified chiropractic physician's assistant; requires person to register as chiropractic assistant if he or she renders therapeutic services or administers therapeutic agents related to chiropractic physician's treatment of patient, etc.

285.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
285.title: Group Insurance for Public Employees
285.description: Requires that school districts procure certain types of insurance through interlocal agreements; provides exception; requires school districts to enter into specified type of interlocal agreement & establish School District Insurance Consortium; provides purposes of consortium; requires that consortium be governed by board of directors consisting of specified number of members; provides requirements for membership on board; specifies terms of office for board members, etc.

286.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
286.title: Local Option Fuel Taxes
286.description: Revises definition of "transportation expenditures" for purposes of specified provisions that restrict use of local option fuel tax funds by counties & municipalities.

287.title: Affordable Housing
287.description: Provides housing finance authority with additional purpose for which it may exercise power to borrow; revises provisions relating to local comprehensive plans to authorize inclusion of element for affordable housing for certain seniors; provides for disposition of real property by local government for certain purposes; revises allocation of certain proceeds distributed from excise tax on documents that are paid into State Treasury to credit of State Housing Trust Fund, etc.

288.title: Tax Administration
288.description: Extends period of exemption under certain circumstances from filing of returns with respect to tax on estates of decedents or tax on generation-skipping transfers; provides for retroactive application; requires sellers of alcoholic beverages or tobacco products to file information reports of sales of those products to retailers in this state with DOR; provides definitions; requires such reports to be filed electronically & to include specified information; authorizes department to waive certain requirements; provides penalties for noncompliance.

290.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
290.title: State Symbols
290.description: Designates Barking Tree Frog as official state amphibian.

291.title: Protection of Volunteers
291.description: Clarifies that in order to fall under protection of Florida Volunteer Protection Act, person performing service for nonprofit organization may not receive compensation from nonprofit organization for that service, regardless of whether person is receiving compensation from another source; provides exception; provides immunity for source of any other such compensation; provides application of act.

292.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
292.title: Water Management Districts
292.description: Revises provisions relating to membership of basin boards; provides that governing board members serving on basin boards are voting members, counted for quorum purposes, & basin board chairs & co-chairs; authorizes basin boards to transact official business if vacancy occurs; deletes provisions providing for formation of Manasota Basin & basin board; exempts cooperative funding programs from certain rulemaking requirements, etc.

293.title: Reuse of Reclaimed Water
293.description: Provides requirements for water management districts in evaluating applications for the consumptive use of water in mandatory reuse zones.

294.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
294.title: Drug Testing/Unemployment Compensation
294.description: Creates Drug Deterrence Program within AWI; provides legislative intent; provides scope of eligibility for benefits; defines terms; provides for screening of individuals to determine which individuals must be tested; provides for notice; provides terms of disqualification for benefits; requires agency to supply information concerning drug treatment programs; provides for authentication & admissibility of drug tests in unemployment compensation hearings, etc.

295.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
295.title: Criminal Prosecution of Juveniles
295.description: Prohibits filing of an information on child otherwise eligible if it is child's first offense unless there are compelling reasons; requires such reasons to be stated in writing; provides criteria for determining when case against juvenile should be recommended to court to be transferred for prosecution in adult court; provides criteria for consideration of child's request to adult court to return criminal case to juvenile justice system.

296.title: Martin County
296.description: Limits issuance of special alcoholic beverage licenses to restaurants that serve certain number of patrons, occupy certain amount of floor space, & are located within legal boundaries of community redevelopment areas of county.

298.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
298.title: Nursing Home Litigation Reform
298.description: Specifies conditions under which nursing home resident has cause of action against licensee or management company; requires trial judge to conduct evidentiary hearing before claimant can assert claim against certain interested parties; provides limitation on recovery; requires evidence of basis for punitive damages; requires trial judge to conduct evidentiary hearing before claimant can assert claim for punitive damages; permits licensee or management company to be held liable for punitive damages, etc.

299.title: State Forests
299.description: Requires designation of "Wounded Warrior Special Hunt Areas" within state forests; limits guest admittance to such areas for eligible veterans, servicemembers, & certain persons; requires that funding for specialized accommodations be provided through specified sources; authorizes DOACS' Division of Forestry to adopt rules.

300.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
300.title: Conditions of Probation
300.description: Requires defendant's probation officer to evaluate certain specified factors before alleging to court that defendant has violated his or her probation because defendant failed to pay court-ordered restitution.

301.title: Pub. Rec./Local Government Inspector General
301.description: Expands exemption from public records requirements to include certain records relating to investigations in custody of inspector general of local government; provides for future review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

302.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
302.title: Enterprise Zones
302.description: Authorizes City of Palm Bay to apply to OTTED for designation of enterprise zone; provides application deadline; provides requirements for area of enterprise zone; requires OTTED to establish effective date of enterprise zone.

303.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
303.title: Research and Development Tax Credits
303.description: Revises legislative intent to include research & development tax credit in ordered list according to which credits against corporate income tax or franchise tax are applied; provides research & development tax credit of specified amount for application by business enterprise against corporate income tax or franchise tax; provides limitation on amount of research & development tax credit that may be applied by business enterprise against tax liability in taxable year; authorizes carryforward of tax credit for specified period, etc.

304.last_action: Withdrawn from HHS Access Subcommittee; Health Care Appropriations Subcommittee; Health and Human Services Committee
304.title: Crisis Stabilization Units
304.description: Increases number of client beds crisis stabilization unit is authorized to provide.

305.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
305.title: Exemptions/Tax on Sales, Use, & Other Transactions
305.description: Exempts certain items used to manufacture, produce, or modify gas turbine engine parts from tax on sales, use, & other transactions.

306.title: Pub. Rec./Office of Financial Regulation
306.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for information held by OFR that is received from another state or federal regulatory, administrative, or criminal justice agency & is otherwise confidential or exempt pursuant to laws of that state or pursuant to federal law; provides exemption from public records requirements for information held by OFR that is received or developed by OFR as part of joint or multiagency examination or investigation with another state or federal regulatory, administrative, or criminal justice agency, etc.

308.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
308.title: Resident Status for Tuition Purposes
308.description: Provides that veterans of Armed Services of United States, including reserve components thereof, who attend public college, university, or institution of higher learning are residents for tuition purposes.

309.title: Driver Education and Testing
309.description: Requires curricula of driver improvement courses & traffic law & substance abuse education courses to include instruction on risks associated with using handheld electronic communication device while operating motor vehicle; provides requirements for driver's license examination questions pertaining to traffic regulations relating to blind pedestrians; provides for written examination for learner's driver's license to be available from third-party providers, etc.

310.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
310.title: Verification of Employment Eligibility
310.description: Requires every employer to use Employment Authorization Program to verify employment eligibility of each employee on or after specified date; provides that business that does not use federal E-Verify system to verify employment eligibility of employee shall lose its license to do business in state until business has registered with E-verify system; prohibits employer from employing unauthorized alien; requires every public employer to register with & participate in E-Verify system for specified purposes, etc.

311.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
311.title: Postsecondary Education of Military Veterans
311.description: Requires that veteran who meets specified criteria be admitted to Florida College System institution or state university of veteran's choice.

312.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
312.title: Presidential Preference Primary
312.description: Revises dates relating to presidential preference primary.

313.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
313.title: Disability Awareness
313.description: Requires district school boards to provide disability history & awareness instruction in public schools during first week in October; requires individuals certified in disability awareness or exceptional student education teachers to provide instruction; requires Governor's Commission on Disabilities to initiate study on training in disability awareness; requires commission to oversee statewide program for providers of training in disability awareness; requires commission to promote training in disability awareness in all public entities in state.

314.title: Southeast Volusia Hospital District/Volusia County
314.description: Expands representation of district's governing body.

315.title: Property Rights
315.description: Shortens notice period for certain actions; revises procedures for determining governmental entity's final decision identifying allowable uses for property; defines what constitutes first application of law or regulation; clarifies waiver of sovereign immunity for liability; provides for prospective application.

316.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 652 (Ch.
316.title: Liability of Spaceflight Entities
316.description: Saves from future repeal provisions that provide spaceflight entities with immunity from liability for loss, damage, or death of participant resulting from inherent risks of spaceflight activities; includes certain manufacturers & suppliers within meaning of spaceflight entity.

317.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
317.title: Criminal Conduct
317.description: Defines term "mental injury" with respect to offenses of abuse, aggravated abuse, & neglect of child; requires that person acting as expert witness have certain credentials; provides affirmative defenses to offenses of child abuse, aggravated child abuse, & neglect; redefines term "crime" for purposes of crime victims compensation to include additional forms of injury.

318.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
318.title: Agriculture
318.description: Prohibits county from enforcing certain limits on activity of bona fide farm operation on agricultural land or charging such land for stormwater management assessments & fees; allows assessment to be collected if credits against assessment are provided for implementation of best management practices; provides exemptions from certain restrictions on county's powers over activity on agricultural land; creates "Agricultural Land Acknowledgement Act", etc.

319.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 960 (Ch.
319.title: Liquefied Petroleum Gas
319.description: Prohibits DOACS & other state agencies from requiring compliance with certain national standards for liquefied petroleum gas tanks unless DOACS or agencies require compliance with specified edition of national standards; provides for conditional repeal; revises term "propane" for purposes of Florida Propane Gas Education, Safety, & Research Act.

321.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
321.title: Special Districts
321.description: Revises provisions relating to merger & dissolution procedures for special districts; provides for certain merger & dissolution procedures to include referenda; provides that such provisions preempt certain special acts; provides for local governments to assume indebtedness of, & receive title to property owned by, special districts under certain circumstances, etc.

322.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
322.title: Public School Attendance
322.description: Creates Student Preparedness Pilot Program to include Duval County School District as one of selected school districts; requires that students in pilot program districts who are 16-18 years of age & do not regularly attend school shall be subject to attendance & completion requirements; requires pilot program districts to identify curricula options; requires annual study & report by OPPAGA.

323.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
323.title: Recovering, Towing, or Storing Vehicles or Vessels
323.description: Revises procedures for notification concerning liens for recovery of certain costs for recovering, towing, or storing vehicle or vessel; removes authority of DHSMV to release information concerning insurance company; establishes fees for lien notification; revises requirements governing contents of notification; revises requirements for locating & notifying persons about impending sale of unclaimed vehicle or vessel or its contents; revises requirements concerning public notice of impending sale.

324.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
324.title: Effects of Crimes
324.description: Provides that court may not make equitable distribution of property in dissolution of marriage to party convicted of certain offenses concerning other party; prohibits persons convicted of specified crimes after marriage from receiving alimony; provides that parent who commits specified offenses against minor child shall lose all right to intestate succession in child's estate & all right to administer estate; provides for distribution of that share of estate.

325.title: Reciprocity in Workers' Compensation Claims
325.description: Exempts certain employees working in state & employers of such workers from Florida's Workers' Compensation Law under certain conditions; provides requirements for establishment of prima facie evidence that employer carries certain workers' compensation insurance; requires courts to take judicial notice of construction of certain laws; provides requirements for claims made in other states; provides criteria for employees to be considered temporarily in state; provides application.

327.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
327.title: Expunging Criminal History Records
327.description: Permits automatic expunction of criminal history records in specified circumstances; provides procedures; provides for effect of expunction; provides for treatment of certain statutory cross-references; conforms provisions.

328.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
328.title: Florida Education Finance Program
328.description: Requires that DOE enter into contract with entity located outside state to conduct study & review of FEFP & recommend improvements; requires that DOE submit report to Legislature & Governor; provides appropriation & for carryforward of unexpended balance of funds. APPROPRIATION:

330.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
330.title: Division of Forestry
330.description: Renames Division of Forestry of DOACS as Florida Forest Service; redesignates director of division as State Forester; clarifies & conforms various provisions.

331.title: 911 Calls
331.description: Prohibits publication or broadcast of recordings of calls to 911 emergency services by minors & recordings of such calls by adults unless voices of all persons recorded are obscured or masked so as to render persons recorded unidentifiable; provides construction.

333.title: Lake Worth Drainage District, Palm Beach County
333.description: Authorizes district to develop & operate water supply facilities & enter into interlocal agreements with local governments & public & private utilities for such purpose; provides for issuance of notes & bonds; prohibits district from engaging in retail water sales.

334.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
334.title: Special Assessment for Law Enforcement Services
334.description: Authorizes municipality to impose special assessment to fund costs of providing law enforcement services; makes imposition of assessment contingent upon adoption of ordinance approved by governing body of municipality & reduction in municipality's ad valorem millage; limits maximum millage reduction required; specifies rolled-back rate for calculation of future increase in ad valorem millage; provides for construction of act as general law authorizing taxation by municipality.

335.title: Polk County Historical Commission, Polk County
335.description: Revises number of commissioners; provides for membership, meetings, rules of procedure, & staff; provides powers & duties; provides for funding & dedicated accounts for county historical museum & genealogical library; deletes provisions relating to Polk County Historical Association; requires board of county commissioners to provide repository for museum & library materials.

336.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
336.title: Infants Born Alive
336.description: Designates act "Born Alive Infant Protection Act"; provides that infant born alive subsequent to abortion is entitled to same rights, powers, & privileges as child born alive in course of birth that is not subsequent to abortion; provides standard of care to be exercised by health care practitioners toward such child; requires health care practitioners to report violations; provides that violations may constitute grounds for discipline of health care practitioners under specified provision.

337.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
337.title: DBPR/Division of Alcoholic Beverages and Tobacco
337.description: Revises provisions relating to issuance by division of temporary permits to nonprofit civic organizations to sell alcoholic beverages; authorizes issuance of permits to any nonprofit organization; allows sale to include beverages for consumption on or off premises.

338.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
338.title: Exemption from Hunter Safety Course Requirements
338.description: Provides exemption from hunter safety course requirements for persons issued a permit, license, or authorization to take game or fur-bearing animals on private land; directs FWCC to adopt rules.

339.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
339.title: Secondary Metals Recyclers
339.description: Revises period required for secondary metals recyclers to maintain certain information about transactions; revises requirements for types of information that must be maintained regarding transactions; provide for method of payment for restricted regulated metals property; prohibits secondary metals recyclers from purchasing regulated metals property without maintaining certain records; deletes provisions prohibiting purchase of regulated metals property from certain persons or at certain locations, etc.

340.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
340.title: Seaport Security
340.description: Deletes provisions requiring FDLE to establish statewide seaport access eligibility reporting system; specifies that federal Transportation Worker Identification Credential is only authorization required for obtaining access to secure & restricted areas of seaport; deletes requirements for performing criminal history screening on certain persons authorized to regularly enter secure & restricted areas.

342.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
342.title: Stimulating Special Event Tourism and Job Creation
342.description: Provides for transfer of certain sales tax revenues from General Revenue Fund to Revenue Sharing Trust Fund for Counties; authorizes county to designate certain time periods to hold special events designed to enhance tourism; authorizes specified distribution from sales tax proceeds when increase in sales tax collections is realized over preceding year by county during same designated time period; provides for specified adjustment of aggregate amount to be transferred from General Revenue Fund to Revenue Sharing Trust Fund for Counties, etc.

343.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
343.title: Funerals, Burials, and Memorial Services
343.description: Prohibits picketing or engaging in other protest activities within specified distance of property line of location of funeral, burial, or memorial service for certain persons.

344.title: High School Athletic Trainers
344.description: Provides for adoption of rules by Board of Athletic Training within DOH; requires certain continuing education for licensed athletic trainers on prevention & emergency management of concussions & catastrophic spinal cord, neck, & brain injuries; requires school districts to employ at least one full-time certified athletic trainer at each high school in this state; requires athletic trainers at high schools to be certified by National Athletic Trainers' Association, etc.

345.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
345.title: Special Observances
345.description: Designates August 7 annually as Purple Heart Day.

346.title: Local Government
346.description: Authorizes board of county commissioners to negotiate lease of certain real property for limited period; authorizes transfers of right-of-way between local governments by deed.

347.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
347.title: Lealman Special Fire District, Pinellas County
347.description: Reduces maximum ad valorem millage rate that may be levied by district; provides requirements for annexation of unincorporated territory of district by municipality; requires approval of an annexation at referendum; provides for future expiration of requirements for annexation; provides that a referendum is not required to approve the levy of an ad valorem tax at a millage rate less than a millage rate previously approved by referendum.

348.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
348.title: State Budget
348.description: Requires that certain expenditures by state agency for construction project must be separate line item in General Appropriations Act.

349.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
349.title: Termination of Parental Rights
349.description: Provides that only in cases involving immediate threat to health or safety of child may person take child alleged to be dependant into custody; provides additional exceptions; requires formation of citizen review panels & deletes requirement that citizen review panel be authorized through administrative order by chief judge of circuit; authorizes citizen review panels to make recommendations in adjudicatory hearings & trials under specified provision, etc.

351.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
351.title: Port of Palm Beach District, Palm Beach County
351.description: Provides for conveyance of certain property to Port of Palm Beach District from DOT; provides boundaries of property to be conveyed.

352.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
352.title: Restraint of Incarcerated Pregnant Women
352.description: Prohibits use of restraints on prisoner known to be pregnant during labor, delivery, & postpartum recovery unless corrections official makes individualized determination that prisoner presents extraordinary circumstance requiring restraints; provides that doctor, nurse, or other health care professional treating prisoner may request that restraints not be used, in which case corrections officer or other official accompanying prisoner shall remove all restraints; requires that any restraint applied must be done in least restrictive manner, etc.

353.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
353.title: Neighborhood Improvement Districts
353.description: Provides & revises provisions relating to neighborhood improvement districts, including creation & funding of safe districts, powers & duties of municipalities & counties, requirements, bonds & assessments, governing bodies, board of directors; property owners' associations, state grants, special neighborhood improvement districts, community redevelopment neighborhood improvement districts, powers of local governing bodies, & ad valorem tax on real or personal property, etc.

354.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
354.title: Public Safety Telecommunicators
354.description: Exempts sworn state-certified law enforcement officers from certification requirements for public safety telecommunicators.

355.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
355.title: Recall
355.description: Provides that Governor, Lieutenant Governor, member of Cabinet, or legislator may be recalled from office; requires that proponents of recall register as political committee; prescribes methods & timeframes for initiating & conducting recall; provides ballot language; provides that removal of Governor from office includes removal of Lieutenant Governor; authorizes adoption of rules.

356.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
356.title: Public High School Students
356.description: Prohibits public high school student from leaving school grounds during designated lunch period; requires that district school boards implement prohibition by specified date.

357.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
357.title: Infant Eye Care
357.description: Requires certain eye examinations for all infants born in hospitals in state; exempts this requirement from penalty provision; revises exception to certain applicability requirements concerning infant eye care; provides that coverage for children under health insurance policies & HMO contracts must include certain eye examinations for infants & children.

359.title: Interscholastic and Intrascholastic Sports
359.description: Removes provisions relating to pilot program in which middle school student or high school student in private school may participate in athletics at public school; provides for statewide implementation of program; requires maintenance of records of participating students; limits participation in program to students who are enrolled in non-FHSAA member private schools consisting of maximum number of students.

360.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
360.title: Nonjudicial Foreclosure/Commercial Real Property
360.description: Provides for applicability of provisions; provides for appointment of trustee; provides for trustee initiation of foreclosure of mortgage liens; provides for objections by obligors; provides for redemption of property; provides requirements to be met before encumbered property may be sold by trustee; provides for notice & manner of sale; specifies effect of sale; provides for trustee's certificate of compliance & deed; provides for disposition of sale proceeds, etc.

361.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
361.title: State Agency Business Cards
361.description: Requires DMS to delegate to state agencies authority to braille their business cards or purchase business cards that are brailled.

362.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 1007 (Ch.
362.title: Property and Casualty Insurance
362.description: Provides statute of limitations for breach of property insurance contract; provides that specified losses are excluded from definition of term "losses" as used in provisions relating to Florida Hurricane Catastrophe Fund; authorizes insurer to renegotiate terms of specified surplus note; revises amount of surplus funds required for domestic insurers applying for certificate of authority; revises minimum surplus that must be maintained by certain insurers; authorizes OIR to reduce specified surplus requirements, etc.

363.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
363.title: Charitable Organizations
363.description: Provides requirements for unattended donation bins operated by charitable organizations; requires certain signage; requires that charitable organization receive specified percentage of donated property.

364.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
364.title: Unclaimed Deposits Held by Utilities
364.description: Requires that any unclaimed deposits held by utility be deposited into Energy Affordability Trust Fund within DCA for purpose of supplementing Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program.

365.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
365.title: Energy Affordability Trust Fund/DCA
365.description: Creates Energy Affordability Trust Fund within DCA; provides purpose of trust fund & source of funds.; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund.

366.title: Endowment Foundation for Vocational Rehabilitation
366.description: Revises provisions for distribution of specified funds received from civil penalties for traffic infractions; directs funds to be transmitted monthly by DOR directly to foundation; removes provisions for investment by SBA; directs liquid balances of such funds held by SBA to be remitted to foundation.

367.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
367.title: Elections
367.description: Provides circumstances under which voting system audit is not required to be conducted; deletes certain required justifications for supervisor to send absentee ballot to alternative address; increases number of days before election that county canvassing board may begin canvassing absentee ballots & processing absentee ballots when electronic tabulating equipment is used.

368.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 670 (Ch.
368.title: Powers of Attorney
368.description: Provides for durable power of attorney; specifies agent qualifications; provides execution requirements; provides for military power of attorney; provides for meaning & effectiveness; specifies when power is effective; provides limitations on future power; provides for termination or suspension of power or agent's authority; provides for revocation; provides for designation of co-agents & successor agents; provides for acceptance of & reliance upon power of attorney; authorizes third party to require affidavit, etc.

369.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
369.title: Taxi Operators
369.description: Authorizes governmental units that regulate operation of taxis to create private property right in license to operate taxi; provides for transfer of such property right.

370.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
370.title: Employment of Felons
370.description: Provides tax credit for employment of persons previously convicted of felonies; provides requirements to receive credit; provides exceptions for certain felons.

371.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
371.title: Eyewitness Identification
371.description: Requires state & county law enforcement agencies to establish & implement written policies & procedures addressing eyewitness identification; specifies requirements of policies & procedures; requires state & county agencies to submit such policies & procedures to local state attorney by specified date; requires Florida Prosecuting Attorneys Association to develop draft jury instructions to be submitted to Supreme Court for consideration by specified date, etc.

372.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
372.title: Loan Processing
