832.description: Creates Florida Drug, Device, and Cosmetic Trust Fund within DBPR; provides for purpose of trust fund & sources of funds; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund.

833.title: Operating Trust Fund/DOE
833.description: Re-creates Operating Trust Fund within DOE without modification; abrogates provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform.

834.title: Administrative Trust Fund/DOE
834.description: Re-creates Administrative Trust Fund within DOE without modification; abrogates provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform.

835.title: Federal Grants Trust Fund/DHSMV
835.description: Re-creates Federal Grants Trust Fund within DHSMV without modification; abrogates provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform.

836.title: International Registration Clearing TF/DHSMV
836.description: Terminates International Registration Clearing Trust Fund within DHSMV; provides for disposition of balances in & revenues of trust fund; prescribes procedures for terminating trust fund; repeals provisions relating to exemption from termination provided for trust fund.

837.title: State Courts Revenue Trust Fund/SCS
837.description: Re-creates State Courts Revenue Trust Fund within State Courts System without modification; abrogates provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform.

838.title: State Attorneys Revenue Trust Fund/JAC
838.description: Re-creates State Attorneys Revenue Trust Fund within Justice Administrative Commission without modification; abrogates provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform.

839.title: Public Defenders Revenue Trust Fund/JAC
839.description: Re-creates Public Defenders Revenue Trust Fund within Justice Administrative Commission without modification; abrogates provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform.

840.title: Indigent Civil Defense Trust Fund/JAC
840.description: Re-creates Indigent Civil Defense Trust Fund within Justice Administrative Commission without modification; abrogates provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform.

841.title: Federal Grants Trust Fund/DJJ
841.description: Re-creates Federal Grants Trust Fund within DJJ without modification; abrogates provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform.

842.title: Operating Trust Fund/DLA
842.description: Re-creates Operating Trust Fund within DLA without modification; abrogates provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform.

843.title: Federal Grants Trust Fund/DLA
843.description: Re-creates Federal Grants Trust Fund within DLA without modification; abrogates provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform.

844.title: OGSR/DJJ Employees and Family Members
844.description: Removes scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act of exemption from public records requirements for identification & location information of certain current & former employees of DJJ & their family members; revises job classifications specified in exemption to reflect those classifications used by DJJ.

845.title: OGSR/Biometric Identification Information
845.description: Removes scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act of exemption from public records requirements for biometric identification information held by agency.

846.title: OGSR/Florida Center for Brain Tumor Research
846.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying information of donor to central repository for brain tumor biopsies or brain tumor registry of Florida Center for Brain Tumor Research; provides for retroactive application of exemption; provides exception to exemption; provides for future review & repeal; provides statement of public necessity.

847.title: OGSR/Statewide Public Guardianship Office
847.description: Removes scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act of exemption from public records requirements for information that identifies certain donors or prospective donors to direct-support organization for Statewide Public Guardianship Office; removes superfluous & duplicative language.

848.title: OGSR/Interference with Custody
848.description: Removes scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act of public records exemption for information submitted to sheriff or state attorney for purpose of obtaining immunity from prosecution for offense of interference with custody.

849.title: OGSR/Court Monitors in Guardianship Proceedings
849.description: Removes scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act of exemption from public records requirements for court records relating to court monitors in guardianship proceedings; consolidates provisions; provides that orders appointing nonemergency court monitors are exempt rather than confidential & exempt; provides that only court orders finding no probable cause are confidential & exempt.

850.title: Education Law Repeals
850.description: (THIS BILL COMBINES H7087 & H7091) Repeals provisions relating to creation of Digital Divide Council in DOE, false claims of academic degree or title, pilot project for discounted computers & Internet access for low-income students, Institute on Urban Policy & Commerce, adult literacy centers, Florida Literacy Corps, Preteacher & Teacher Education Pilot Programs & Teacher Education Pilot Programs for High-Achieving Students, Critical Teacher Shortage Program, Florida Teacher Scholarship & Forgivable Loan Program, etc.

854.title: Prescription Drugs
854.description: Makes failure to comply with requirements of s. 456.44, F.S., grounds for disciplinary action; provides mandatory administrative penalties for certain violations related to prescribing; requires prescriptions for controlled substances to be written on counterfeit-resistant pad produced by approved vendor or electronically prescribed; provides conditions for being approved vendor; requires certain physicians to designate themselves as controlled substance prescribing practitioners on their practitioner profiles, etc. APPROPRIATION:

856.title: Pub. Rec./OPPAGA Work Papers
856.description: Creates exemption from public records requirements for work papers held by OPPAGA that relate to authorized project or research product; provides for retroactive application; provides statement of public necessity; provides contingent effective date.

857.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
857.title: Judicial Nominating Commissions
857.description: Repeals provisions relating to judicial nominating commissions; provides for commissions; specifies membership & composition; provides for appointment of members by Governor; provides for terms; requires Governor to consider racial, ethnic, gender, & geographic diversity in making appointments; provides for suspension of member of judicial nominating commission; establishes quorum; provides for administrative support; abolishes prior offices; permits reappointment of former officeholders.

860.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
860.title: Supreme Court
860.description: Repeals provisions relating to restricting practice of law by retired justice, requirement to appoint Clerk of Supreme Court, requirement that clerk have office in Supreme Clerk Building, requirement that clerk perform duties as directed by court, & provision by which rules of court supersede statutes.

861.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
861.title: Judicial Census Commissions
861.description: Repeals provisions relating to judicial census commissions.

862.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
862.title: Sheriffs
862.description: Repeals provisions providing that county sheriff serve as executive officer of circuit court; removes provision requiring sheriff to perform duties of executive officer of county court.

863.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
863.title: District Courts of Appeal
863.description: Repeals provisions relating to requirement that district court sit in three judge panels & have majority for decision & requirement that clerk of district court perform duties prescribed by rule of court.

864.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
864.title: Offers of Settlement
864.description: Repeals provisions relating to offers of settlement made prior to 1990; conforms cross-references.

865.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
865.title: Declaratory Judgment Actions
865.description: Repeals provisions relating to taxable costs.

866.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
866.title: Veteran's Guardianship
866.description: Repeals provisions relating to guardians of incapacitated world war veterans.

867.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
867.title: Prison Diversion Programs
867.description: Increases number of Criminal Punishment Code scoresheet total sentence points that offender may have & be eligible for prison diversion program; provides that prison diversion program may require jail term not to exceed 90 days or electronic monitoring.

869.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
869.title: Seat Requirements
869.description: Repeals provisions that require employers who require employees to stand or walk during their duties to provide seats for such employees when not engaged in their active work; repeals provisions that require employers to permit specified employees to use seats during business hours, for purposes of necessary rest, when such use will not interfere with requirements of employment; deletes penalty.

870.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
870.title: Failure to Assist Officers at Polls
870.description: Repeals provision which provides that any person summoned by sheriff or deputy sheriff who fails or refuses to assist in maintaining peace at polls is guilty of first-degree misdemeanor.

871.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
871.title: Cotton or Leaf Tobacco
871.description: Repeals provisions prohibiting person from trading, trafficking for, or buying, except from producer or producer's authorized agent, cotton or leaf tobacco unless it is baled or boxed in usual manner or written evidence that producer has parted with her or his interest is exhibited.

872.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
872.title: County-operated Boot Camp Programs
872.description: Repeals provisions relating to authorization for placement of youthful offenders in county-operated boot camp programs.

873.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
873.title: Levying War Against People of the State
873.description: Repeals provisions relating to prohibition on combinations against any people of state for certain purposes.

874.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
874.title: Adulterated Syrup
874.description: Repeals provisions relating to prohibition on certain acts relating to adulterated syrup unless specified information is provided.

876.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
876.title: Unlawful Use of Insignia
876.description: Repeals provisions relating to unlawful use of insignia of American Legion by nonmember.

877.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
877.title: Correctional Policy Advisory Council
877.description: Repeals provisions relating to creation, membership, & duties of Correctional Policy Advisory Council.

878.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
878.title: Water Hyacinths
878.description: Repeals provisions relating to prohibition on placing water hyacinths in any of streams or waters of state.

881.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
881.title: Reemployment Services
881.description: Revises definition of terms "qualified rehabilitation provider" & "reemployment assessment"; revises intent; revises & provides certain carrier reporting requirements; revises rehabilitation provider reporting requirements; revises provisions relating to medical care coordination & reemployment services; revises procedures for approval of certain formal training & education programs; repeals authorization to use Workers Compensation Trust Funds for certain purposes; repeals rehabilitation provider qualifications, etc.

882.title: OGSR/Commission on Ethics Audits & Investigations
882.description: Removes from scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act exemption from public records & public meetings requirements for certain audits & investigations conducted by Commission on Ethics; reorganizes exemptions & makes editorial changes.

883.title: OGSR/Concealed Weapons or Firearms
883.description: Removes from scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act an exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying information of an applicant for or recipient of a license to carry a concealed weapon or firearm.

884.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1346 (Ch.
884.title: Former Department of Labor and Employment Security
884.description: Repeals provisions relating to agreements appointing county tax collectors as agents of former DLES for licenses & other similar registrations.

885.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1346 (Ch.
885.title: Florida-Caribbean Basin Trade Initiative
885.description: Repeals provisions relating to Florida-Caribbean Basin Trade Initiative.

886.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1346 (Ch.
886.title: Florida Trade Data Center
886.description: Revises requirements for operating plans of state's foreign offices, coordination of activities by Florida-Caribbean Basin Trade Initiative, & use of program funds of Florida Seaport Transportation & Economic Development Program, to delete provisions relating to Florida Trade Data Center.

887.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1346 (Ch.
887.title: Microenterprises
887.description: Repeals provisions relating to contracting by OTTED to foster development of microenterprises.

888.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1346 (Ch.

888.description: Deletes exemption from public records requirements for certain records related to U.S. Department of Defense Base Realignment & Closure 2005 process, exemptions from public meetings requirements & public records requirements for Governor's Advisory Council on Base Realignment & Closure & its committees & subcommittees, & penalties for certain violations related to such public records & public meetings.

889.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1346 (Ch.
889.title: Inner City Redevelopment Review Panel
889.description: Repeals Inner City Redevelopment Review Panel.

890.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1346 (Ch.
890.title: Local Exchange Telecommunications Company Workers
890.description: Repeals provisions relating to assistance for displaced local exchange telecommunications company workers.

891.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1346 (Ch.
891.title: Rulemaking for the Transition Assistance Program
891.description: Removes reference to Agency for Workforce Innovation in rulemaking provisions.

892.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1346 (Ch.
892.title: Vulnerable Children and Adults
892.description: Repeals provisions relating to child abuse prevention training in district school system, development by DCFS of model plan for community intervention & treatment in intrafamily sexual abuse cases, Family Builders Program, authorization for pilot & demonstration projects, foster care privatization demonstration project, Commission on Marriage & Family Support Initiatives, financial commitment to community services programs, respite & family care subsidy expenditures & funding recommendations, etc.

893.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
893.title: Uniform Home Grading Scale
893.description: Repeals obsolete provision relating to method for correlating mitigation discounts, credits, or other rate differentials to uniform home grading scale; repeals specified rulemaking authority of FSC relating to uniform home grading scale; repeals provision requiring discounts, credits, or other rate differentials to supersede other discounts, credits or rate differentials.

896.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
896.title: Florida Water Resources Act of 1972
896.description: Repeals provision relating to liberal construction of ch. 373, F.S.

897.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
897.title: Limited Agricultural Associations
897.description: Repeals provisions relating to formation of limited agricultural associations, membership & powers of such associations, limitation of liability for members of such associations, contents & filing of articles of association for such associations & related filing fees, adoption of bylaws by such associations, & dissolution of such associations.

898.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
898.title: Forest Development
898.description: Repeals provisions relating to establishment & management of community forests by political subdivisions & school districts, appointment of forestry committees, use of revenues from such forests, & sale of such forests.

899.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
899.title: Florida College System Institution Bd. of Trustees
899.description: Removes eligibility for certain faculty at St. Petersburg College to be awarded continuing contracts; provides criteria for employment of personnel newly hired on or after July 1, 2011, by Florida College System institution board of trustees; provides requirements for probationary & annual contracts for administrative, instructional, or educational support personnel; prohibits award of tenure, multiyear contract, or continuing contract; provides exception; provides requirements for dismissal & retention of employees, etc.

901.title: Digital Learning
901.description: Creates Digital Learning Now Act; requires school districts to establish virtual instruction options; authorizes establishment of virtual charter schools & provides requirements; authorizes blended learning courses; provides additional requirements for Florida Virtual School; requires full-time & part-time school district virtual instruction program options; provides funding & accountability requirements; requires online learning course for high school graduation; redefines FTE student for purposes of virtual instruction.

902.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
902.title: Courts
902.description: Provides for divisions of Supreme Court & jurisdiction; authorizes collaboration with other courts; repeals provisions relating to collaboration by Supreme Court with other courts, terms of Supreme Court, practice of law by retired justices of Supreme Court, clerk of Supreme Court, appointment of deputy clerk, location of clerk's office, custody of books, papers, records, files, & seal, & duties of clerk; provides duties of clerk of Supreme Court; revises provisions relating to marshal of Supreme Court, etc. APPROPRIATION:

903.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
903.title: Workers' Compensation Reporting Requirement
903.description: Repeals provision relating to duty of DFS to make annual report on administration of ch. 440, F.S., Workers' Compensation Law, to specified officials.

905.title: State Economic Enhancement and Development TF
905.description: Creates State Economic Enhancement & Development Trust Fund within Department of Economic Opportunity; provides for purpose of trust fund & sources of funds; provides for annual carryforward of funds; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund.

907.title: Consumer Services Functions/DOACS
907.description: Revises various provisions relating to DOACS' consumer services functions, including distribution of motor vehicle consumer's rights pamphlet; requirements for private investigative, private security, recovery agent, firearm, & firearms instructor licenses; method of paying certain fees; criminal history records provided to licensed gun dealers, manufacturers, & exporters; licensing requirements for bodyguard services, private investigator intern licenses, security officer licenses, security officer school licenses, etc.

908.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
908.title: Organization & Standards/Public Service Commission
908.description: Revises provisions relating to Public Service Commission Nominating Council, commissioners, commissioner applicants, & employees of commission, conduct, ex parte communications, investigations & reports of violations, offices, payments, & persons testifying before commission; provides training & education requirements for commissioners & commission employees; transfers Public Counsel to Attorney General; removes provisions for Committee on Public Counsel Oversight.

909.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
909.title: Road and Bridge Designations
909.description: Designates Edna S. Hargrett-Thrower Avenue in Orange County; designates SP4 Thomas Berry Corbin Memorial Highway & U.S. Navy BMC Samuel Calhoun Chavous, Jr. Memorial Highway in Dixie County; designates Marine Lance Corporal Brian R. Buesing Memorial Highway, United States Army Sergeant Karl A. Campbell Memorial Highway, & U.S. Army SPC James A. Page Memorial Highway in Levy County; designates Veterans Memorial Highway in Putnam County, etc.

910.title: Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
910.description: Deletes provision establishing Division of Dairy within department; redefines term "agricultural purposes" as it relates to assessment of land classified as agricultural by property appraiser; exempts certain direct-support organizations & citizen support organizations for department from obtaining independent audit; requires department to establish accounting & financial management guidelines for such organizations & annually review operations & finances of selected number of such organizations, etc. APPROPRIATION:

911.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
911.title: Energy Incentives and Initiatives
911.description: Revises legislative intent relating to state's energy policy; provides legislative intent relating to renewable energy production of electricity; deletes provisions for renewable portfolio standard & renewable energy credits; provides mechanism for providers to recover costs to produce or purchase renewable energy under certain conditions; exempts renewable energy projects for which cost recovery is provided under mechanism from requirements for determination of need, etc.

912.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1312 (Ch.
912.title: School Food Service and Nutrition Programs
912.description: Cites act as "Healthy Schools for Healthy Lives Act"; transfers Food & Nutrition Services Trust Fund from DOE to DACS; transfers & reassigns functions & responsibilities for administration of school food service & nutrition programs from DOE to DACS; requires DACS to conduct & administer programs & cooperate with governmental agencies; conforms provisions; provides for contingent effect based upon federal approval of request for waiver.

913.title: OGSR/Competitive Solicitations
913.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for bids, proposals, or replies submitted to an agency in response to competitive solicitation; expands exemption by extending its duration; provides for future review & repeal; revises provisions that provide exemption from public meetings requirements for meetings at which negotiation with vendor is conducted & which provides exemption from public records requirements for recordings of exempt meetings; expands public meetings exemption to include specified meetings, etc.

914.title: OGSR/SBA Alternative Investments
914.description: Removes from scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act an exemption from public records requirements for SBA; specifies information that does not constitute proprietary confidential business information held by SBA; requires SBA to maintain written list of records covered under verified, written declaration.

916.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
916.title: Procurement
916.description: Deletes duplicative language relating to option of agency to purchase commodities or contractual services from state contract; specifies conditions for preference in award of contract under invitation to bid; requires inclusion of information in invitation to negotiate; revises requirements with respect to agency avoidance, neutralization, or mitigation of potential organizational conflicts of interest prior to award of contract, etc.

918.title: Background Screening
918.description: Exempts certain mental health personnel, volunteers who meet certain criteria, client relatives or spouses, & attorneys in good standing with Florida Bar from background screening requirements; revises provisions relating to background screening of specified employees of health care providers; removes provision authorizing AHCA to adopt rules establishing rescreening schedule; establishes rescreening schedule; exempts certain law enforcement officers from refingerprinting & rescreening requirements under certain conditions, etc.

920.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
920.title: Water Management District Planning and Budgeting
920.description: Requires governing boards of water management districts to review lands to which districts hold title & to make such lands available for purchase under certain conditions; requires local government consent for sale of certain lands; requires approval by EOG for transfer of funds within water management district's final adopted budget.

921.last_action: CS combines this bill with CS/CS/CS/HB 993
921.title: Administrative Procedure
921.description: (THIS BILL COMBINED IN CS for CS/CS/H993 & H7239) Provides for agency reporting of annual regulatory plans; provides for certain omissions & suspensions of reports; provides for legislative review of agency rules in effect on or before Nov. 16, 2010; requires that each agency complete enhanced biennial review of its existing rules; requires report of enhanced biennial review; provides for objections & agency's response; requires performance of compliance economic review & report under certain circumstances; provides specifications for review, etc.

924.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
924.title: Mosquito Control Districts
924.description: Repeals provisions relating to certain powers of board of county commissioners to hold, control, acquire, or purchase real or personal property, condemn land or easements, exercise right of eminent domain, & institute & maintain condemnation proceedings for mosquito control district.

925.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
925.title: Government Reorganization/OTTED, DCA, & AWI
925.description: Creates Department of Economic Opportunity (DEO); provides for appointment of Commissioner of Economic Opportunity, subject to confirmation by Senate; establishes divisions within department; repeals provisions establishing OTTED, DCA, & AWI; transfers functions & trust funds of OTTED to DEO; provides for merger of Florida Sports Foundation, Florida Tourism Industry Marketing Corporation (VISIT Florida), & Florida Black Business Investment Board, Inc., into EFI; revises economic development incentive review process, etc.

926.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
926.title: Federal Grants Trust Fund/EOG/Creation
926.description: Creates Federal Grants TF within EOG; provides for sources of funds & purposes; provides for annual carryforward of trust fund balances; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of TF.

927.description: Eliminates requirement that Florida Building Commission incorporate into Florida Building Code ratio of public restroom facilities for men & women.

928.title: Land Planning Regulations for the Florida Keys
928.description: Ratifies specified rules for sole & exclusive purpose of satisfying any condition on effectiveness pursuant to s. 120.541(3), F.S., which requires ratification of any rule meeting any of specified thresholds for likely adverse impact or increase in regulatory costs.

929.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration

929.description: Enumerates group insurance plans that may be included in state group insurance program; revises duties of DMS relating to group insurance program; provides state contribution toward cost of health insurance plans in state group insurance program for specified plan years; revises authorized benefits; directs department to contract with certain number of HMOs; requires data to be reported to department by HMOs; provides for specified benefit levels for specified plan years; repeals certain duties of department on future date, etc.

995.description: Calls for House of Representatives & Senate to convene in Joint Session at 5:30 p.m. on March 8, 2011, for purpose of receiving message from Governor.

996.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
996.title: Equal Rights for Men and Women
996.description: Ratifies proposed amendment to U.S. Constitution relating to equal rights for men & women.

997.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
997.title: Extension of 2011 Legislative Session
997.description: Extends 2011 Regular Session of Florida Legislature under authority of Section 3(d), Article III of State Constitution.

998.title: Health Care Services
998.description: Proposes creation of s. 28, Art. I of State Constitution to prohibit laws or rules from compelling any person or employer to purchase, obtain, or otherwise provide for health care coverage; permits health care provider to accept direct payment from person or employer for lawful health care services; exempts persons, employers, & health care providers from penalties & taxes for paying or accepting direct payment for lawful health care services; permits purchase or sale of health insurance in private health care systems, etc.

999.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
999.title: Judicial Qualifications
999.description: Amends s. 8, Art. V & creates s. 32, Art. XII of State Constitution to increase amount of time from 5 to 8 years that person must be member of Florida Bar before becoming eligible for office of circuit court or county court judge; provides that amendment does not affect any judge in office on effective date of amendment; provides that any judge qualified to hold office & in office before amendment is effective may remain in office & seek reelection to that office; provides schedule.

1000.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1000.title: Voting Rights of Felons
1000.description: Proposes amendment to s. 4, Art. VI of State Constitution to disqualify person who is convicted of felony from voting only until completion of all sentences imposed & expiration or completion of all conditions of supervision, if any.

1001.title: Death Penalty Cases
1001.description: Proposes creation of s. 22, Art. III of State Constitution to require Legislature by general law to adopt rules governing time limits, procedures, & processes relating to all death penalty cases & related proceedings in all courts.

1002.title: Term Limits
1002.description: Proposes amendment to s. 15, Art. III & s. 4, Art VI & creation of provision in Art. XII of State Constitution to increase length of terms of state senators to 6 years & state representatives to 4 years & limit state senators, state representatives, & elected county & municipal officers to 12 consecutive years in office.

1004.last_action: Withdrawn prior to introduction, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/CS/CS/HJR 381 (Passed) -HJ 29
1004.title: Limitations on Annual Assessment Increases
1004.description: Proposes amendment to s. 4, Art. VII of State Constitution to prohibit annual increases in assessed value of homestead & nonhomestead property if just value of property decreases; limit annual assessment increases applicable to nonhomestead property to lower of specified percentage or percentage change in Consumer Price Index; & apply annual assessment increase limitations applicable to nonhomestead property to school district levies.

1005.title: Property Assessment/Homestead Exemption
1005.description: Proposes amendments to State Constitution to allow Legislature by general law to prohibit increases in assessed value of homestead & specified nonhomestead property if just value of property decreases, reduce limitation on annual assessment increases applicable to nonhomestead real property, provide additional homestead exemption for owners of homestead property who have not owned homestead property for specified time before purchase of current homestead property, & application & limitations with respect thereto, etc.

1006.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1006.title: Ban/Oil Exploration/Drilling/Extraction/Production
1006.description: Proposes amendment to s. 7, Art. II of State Constitution to prohibit exploration, drilling, extraction, & production of oil beneath Florida waters between mean high-water line & seaward limit of Florida's boundaries; exempts transportation of oil produced outside of such waters.

1007.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SJR 592 (Passed) -HJ 1101
1007.title: Veteran's Property Tax Discount
1007.description: Proposes amendment to Section 6 of Article VII & creation of Section 32 of Article XII of State Constitution to expand availability of homestead property tax discount for veterans who became disabled as result of combat injury to include those who were not Florida residents when they entered military service & provide an effective date.

1008.last_action: Withdrawn from Finance and Tax Committee; Community and Military Affairs Subcommittee; Economic Affairs Committee
1008.title: Property Taxes/Homestead and Nonhomestead Property
1008.description: Proposes constitutional amendment to prevent taxes from increasing on homestead & nonhomestead property with declining market value by prohibiting increases in annual assessment & applicable millage rate.

1009.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1009.title: Election of Public Service Commission Members
1009.description: Proposes creation of s. 14, Art. IV & s. 32 of Art XII of State Constitution to provide for elected, five-member Public Service Commission in executive branch & prohibits candidates for election to commission from accepting contributions from employees, lobbyists, officers, directors, or agents of any utility or entity regulated by commission, affiliates of regulated utilities or entities, business entities, law firms, & trade associations under certain circumstances.

1010.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1010.title: Recall Gov./Lt. Gov./Cabinet Member, or Legislator
1010.description: Proposes creation of s. 8, Art. VI of State Constitution to provide for recall of Governor, Lt. Governor, member of Cabinet, or legislator; provides how process is initiated; establishes requisite number & distribution of signatures; provides for simultaneous election of successor to remainder of term; provides that if elected official is not recalled, then additional effort to recall elected official may not be initiated during remainder of term; provides for reimbursement of certain expenses.

1011.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1011.title: Homestead Assessment Limitation/Senior Citizens
1011.description: Proposes amendment to s. 4, Art. VII of State Constitution to authorize counties & municipalities to limit assessed value of homesteads of certain low-income senior citizens.

1012.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1012.title: Duties of the Chief Financial Officer
1012.description: Proposes amendment to s. 4, Art. IV of State Constitution to require Chief Financial Officer to establish & maintain uniform accounting of funds for legislative & judicial branches & all governmental entities & supervise such accounting, & to authorize enforcement of financial & budgetary restrictions provided by law which ensure compliance with accounting procedures & financial requirements.

1013.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1013.title: Senate Confirmation of Justices and Judges
1013.description: Proposes amendment to s. 11, Art. V of State Constitution to provide for Senate confirmation of justices & judges subject to merit-retention vote.

1014.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1014.title: Sovereignty of the State
1014.description: Proposes creation of s. 28, Art. I of State Constitution to assert sovereignty of state & declare right of people of state to refuse to comply with federal mandates that violate U.S. Constitution.

1015.title: Abortion/Public Funding/Construction of Rights
1015.description: Proposes creation of s. 28, Art. I of State Constitution; prohibits public funding of abortions; provides exceptions; prohibits State Constitution from being interpreted to create broader rights to abortion than those contained in U.S. Constitution.

1016.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1016.title: Constitutional Amendments/Presentation to Electors
1016.description: Proposes amendment to s. 5, Art. XI of State Constitution to require amendments to or revisions of State Constitution to be presented to voters in form & manner prescribed by general law enacted by Legislature.

1017.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1017.title: Miami-Dade County Home Rule Charter
1017.description: Proposes amendment to s. 6, Art. VIII of State Constitution to authorize amendments of revisions to Miami-Dade County Home Rule Charter by special law approved by vote of electors of county; requires that such special law be proposed & approved at meeting of local legislative delegation & filed by member of that delegation; conforms references to reflect county's current name.

1018.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1018.title: Board of Governors/Student Body President
1018.description: Proposes amendment to s. 7, Art. IX of State Constitution to remove president of Florida Student Association, or equivalent, as member of Board of Governors of State University System & to require that Governor appoint state university student body president to Board of Governors; requires that state university student body president shall be one of 15 citizen members appointed to Board of Governors by Governor, except that state university student body president is not subject to confirmation by Senate & term of appointment is 1 year, etc.

1019.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1019.title: Medical Use of Cannabis
1019.description: Proposes creation of s. 28, Art. X & s. 32, Art. XII of State Constitution to allow medical use of cannabis by citizens & allow Legislature to implement these provisions by general law.

1020.title: Religious Freedom
1020.description: Proposes amendment to s. 3, Art. I of State Constitution to provide that, consistent with U.S. Constitution, no individual or entity may be denied, on basis of religious identity or belief, governmental benefits, funding, or other support, & to delete prohibition against using revenues from public treasury directly or indirectly in aid of any church, sect, or religious denomination or in aid of any sectarian institution.

1021.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1021.title: Rules of Court
1021.description: Proposes amendment to s. 2, Art. V of State Constitution to provide that no court may adopt rules of practice & procedure; Supreme Court may recommend rules to be adopted, amended, or rejected by Legislature; & providing that, in event of conflict, statute supersedes rule.

1022.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration

1022.description: Proposes amendment to s. 12, Art. V of State Constitution to provide that all records, materials, & proceedings related to complaints & investigations of Judicial Qualifications Commission not otherwise exempt from disclosure are public upon filing of formal charges against judge or upon determination by commission or investigative panel that formal charges will not be filed; removes outdated provisions.

1023.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration

1023.description: Proposes amendment to s. 10, Art. V of State Constitution to increase percentage of votes necessary to retain justices & judges.

1024.description: Establishes new effective date for CS/HB 7103, an act relating to agriculture, which bill was passed by both houses of Legislature during 2010 Regular Session of Legislature & thereafter vetoed by Governor.

1025.description: Establishes new effective date for CS/CS/HB 1207, an act relating to campaign financing, which bill was passed by both houses of Legislature during 2010 Regular Session of Legislature & thereafter vetoed by Governor.

XII of State Constitution to replace existing state revenue limitation with new state revenue limitation based on inflation & population changes, to take effect upon approval by electors & apply beginning in 2014-2015 state fiscal year.

1072.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1072.title: Relief/Melvin and Alma Colindres/City of Miami
1072.description: Provides for relief of Melvin & Alma Colindres by City of Miami; provides for appropriation to compensate them for wrongful death of their son, Kevin Colindres, sustained as result of negligence of police officers of City of Miami; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs. CLAIM:

1073.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1073.title: Relief/Thomas and Karen Brandi/City of Haines City
1073.description: Provides for relief of Thomas & Karen Brandi by city of Haines City; provides for appropriation to compensate them for injuries sustained as result of negligence of city of Haines City; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs. CLAIM:

1074.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1074.title: Relief/Wohlgemuth/Pasco County Sheriff's Office
1074.description: Provides for relief of Jennifer Wohlgemuth by Pasco County Sheriff's Office; provides for appropriation to compensate her for injuries incurred due to negligence of PCSO; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs. CLAIM:

1075.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1075.title: Relief/Eddie Weekley/Charlotte Williams/APD
1075.description: Provides for relief of Eddie Weekley & Charlotte Williams, individually & as co-personal representatives of Estate of Franklin Weekley, their deceased son, for disappearance & death of their son while he was in care of Marianna Sunland Center, currently operated by Agency for Persons with Disabilities; provides appropriation to compensate them for injuries & damages sustained as result of negligence of DCFS; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs. CLAIM WITH APPROPRIATION:

1076.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1076.title: Relief/Darling and Smith/State of Florida
1076.description: Provides for relief of Dennis Darling, Sr., & Wendy Smith, parents of Devaughn Darling, deceased; provides appropriation to compensate them for loss of their son, Devaughn Darling, whose death occurred while he was engaged in football preseason training on FSU campus; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs. CLAIM WITH APPROPRIATION:

1077.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1077.title: Relief/Maricelly Lopez/City of North Miami
1077.description: Provides for relief of Maricelly Lopez by City of North Miami; provides for appropriation to compensate Maricelly Lopez, individually & as personal representative of Estate of Omar Mieles, for wrongful death of her son, Omar Mieles, which was due to negligence of police officer of City of North Miami; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs. CLAIM:

1078.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1078.title: Relief/Carl Abbott/Palm Beach County School Board
1078.description: Provides for relief of Carl Abbott by Palm Beach County School Board; provides for appropriation to compensate Carl Abbott for injuries sustained as result of negligence of Palm Beach County School District; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs. CLAIM:

1079.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1079.title: Environmental Surcharge On Bottled Water
1079.description: Establishes a surcharge on bottled water sold at retail in this state. Provides an exception. Requires that moneys collected from the surcharge be deposited into the Ecosystem Management and Restoration Trust Fund.

1080.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1080.title: State Uniform Traffic Control
1080.description: Prohibits the use of electronic communication devices to send or receive text-based communications while operating a motor vehicle. Provides exceptions. Provides a penalty.

1082.title: Community Colleges
1082.description: Renames Gulf Coast Community College as "Gulf Coast State College." Renames Pensacola Junior College as "Pensacola State College." Renames St. Johns River Community College as "St. Johns River State College." Renames Valencia Community College as "Valencia College." Amends provisions relating to linkage institutes, the Florida School of the Arts, and the consolidation of certain training schools. Conforms provisions.

1089.last_action: Withdrawn from Community Affairs; Judiciary; Governmental Oversight and Accountability
1089.title: Local Government Attorneys
1089.description: Prohibits a local government attorney or the law firm in which the attorney is a member, partner, or employee from representing more than one local government within a county with respect to certain matters.

1093.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1093.title: Public Records
1093.description: Creates an exemption from public records requirements for information that identifies a donor or prospective donor of a donation made for the benefit of a publicly owned performing arts center if the donor desires to remain anonymous. Creates such exemption for information identifying a donor or prospective donor to the direct-support organization of the Legislative Research Center and Museum at the Historic Capitol. Provides for future legislative review and repeal of the exemptions under the Open Government Sunset Review Act, etc.

1094.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1094.title: Public K-12 Health Education
1094.description: Deletes the requirement that schools teach abstinence from sexual activity outside of marriage as the expected standard for all school-age students as part of instruction in human sexuality.

1095.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1095.title: Debtors and Creditors
1095.description: Requires lenders or creditors to verify the identity of persons applying for a loan, credit card, or extension of credit. Provides that the knowing and willful use of personal identifying information of another individual creates a rebuttable presumption. Provides for the forfeiture of the right to collect an indebtedness for failure to verify an applicant's identity.

1099.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1099.title: Probation and Community Control
1099.description: Requires the Department of Corrections to electronically monitor a person who is sentenced to probation or community control.

1100.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1100.title: Private Correctional Facilities
1100.description: Requires that a contractor provide certain minimum services at designated visiting areas in a private correctional facility. Provides for application of the act.

1101.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1101.title: Public Printing
1101.description: Revises the record requirements for agency publications. Requires the record to include the reasons for printing and distributing a publication and whether the publication is available electronically. Requires such justification to be included in the agency's legislative budget request.

1104.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1104.title: Sealing Criminal History Records
1104.description: Cites this act as the "Jim King Keep Florida Working Act." Authorizes a court to seal a criminal history record of a person who had a prior criminal history record sealed or expunged under certain circumstances.

1112.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1112.title: Congenital Craniofacial Anomalies
1112.description: Requires the Agency for Health Care Administration, in consultation with the Office of Insurance Regulation, to conduct a study concerning the medical necessity, costs, and efficacy of mandating coverage for certain treatments and therapies. Requires that the agency report its findings and recommendations to the Legislature. APPROPRIATION:

1113.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1113.title: Juvenile Justice Education Programs
1113.description: Requires that the Department of Education submit to the Legislature an annual report that includes student learning gains and student progression in juvenile justice education programs and details the methodology that the department uses to ensure that the student performance data is complete and reliable.

1133.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1133.title: Domestic Violence Against Family Pets
1133.description: Redefines the term "domestic violence" to include inflicting, or attempting to inflict, physical injury against an animal owned, possessed, leased, kept, or held by one family or household member by another family or household member, or placing a family or household member in fear of physical harm to an animal owned, possessed, leased, kept, or held by that family or household member, etc.

1136.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1136.title: Game Promotions
1136.description: Requires operators of certain electronic-based game promotions to comply with specified requirements governing game promotions.

1144.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1144.title: Child Safety Devices in Motor Vehicles
1144.description: Provides child-restraint requirements for children ages 4 through 7 years of age who are less than a specified height. Provides certain exceptions. Redefines the term "motor vehicle" to exclude certain vehicles from such requirements. Provides a grace period.

1147.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1147.title: Motor Vehicles/Highway Safety Act
1147.description: Provides legislative intent relating to road rage and aggressive careless driving. Requires an operator of a motor vehicle to yield the left lane when being overtaken on a multilane highway. Specifies the amount of the fine and the allocation of moneys received from the increased fine imposed for aggressive careless driving. Requires the HSMV to provide information about the Highway Safety Act in driver's license educational materials, etc.

1150.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1150.title: Compensation for Wrongful Incarceration
1150.description: Requires that a petition for compensation describe the existence of clear and convincing evidence of actual innocence. Requires the petitioner to submit fingerprints for criminal history records checks. Provides for compensation of reasonable attorney's fees and expenses, up to $50,000, incurred for pursuing compensation for wrongful incarceration. Precludes submission of an application for compensation if the wrongfully incarcerated person has received a prior favorable judgment from a civil action arising out of the wrongful incarceration, etc.

1151.last_action: Withdrawn from Commerce and Tourism; Governmental Oversight and Accountability; Budget
1151.title: Florida Infrastructure Fund Partnership
1151.description: Provides legislative intent to increase the availability of later stage venture equity capital and infrastructure funding. Creates the Florida Infrastructure Fund Partnership. Specifies the purpose and duties of the partnership, which is to facilitate investment in the state's infrastructure. Creates the Florida Infrastructure Investment Trust. Authorizes the trust to issue certificates to investors, which are redeemable as tax credits, etc.

1153.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1153.title: Legislative Travel Reimbursement
1153.description: Authorizes legislators and their staff members to be reimbursed by the state under certain circumstances for travel to visit an immediate family member in the case of death or serious illness. Defines the term "immediate family member."

1154.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1154.title: Student Assessment in Public Schools
1154.description: Terminates the administration of the Florida Comprehensive Assessment Test (FCAT) to students in grades 9 through 12. Requires that the Preliminary SAT/National Merit Scholarship Qualifying Test (PSAT/NMSQT) replace the grade 10 FCAT for purposes of measuring a student's knowledge and skills. Requires that students earn passing scores on the PSAT/NMSQT to qualify for a standard high school diploma. Provides for application beginning with students entering grade 9 in the 2012-2013 school year, etc.

1159.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1159.title: Super Enterprise Zones
1159.description: Defines the term "certified business" for purposes of a tax exemption provided to certain businesses located within a super enterprise zone. Provides a tax exemption for certain property purchased for use or consumption by businesses in a super enterprise zone and for retail sales made by certified businesses in a super enterprise zone. Requires the Office of Tourism, Trade, and Economic Development to designate specified areas in Miami-Dade, Lee, and Collier Counties as pilot project super enterprise zones for a certain period, etc.

1160.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1160.title: Property Tax Discounts for Early Payment
1160.description: Increases the discount rates for early payment of property taxes. Lowers the percentage of certified taxable value to be used by taxing authorities in preparing tentative budgets. Increases the discount rates for prepayment of property tax by the installment method.

1164.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1164.title: Employment of Children/Entertainment Industry
1164.description: Provides requirements for the employment of children in the entertainment industry. Provides responsibilities of employers and parents or legal guardians of such children. Requires a preauthorization certificate for each child. Provides duties of the Division of Regulation within the Department of Business and Professional Regulation. Provides certification requirements and duties of teachers and trainers of child performers, etc.

1166.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1166.title: Sustainable & Renewable Energy Policy Trust Fund
1166.description: Creates the Sustainable and Renewable Energy Policy Trust Fund within the Florida Energy and Climate Commission. Provides for sources of funds and purposes. Provides for annual carryforward of funds. Provides for the future review and termination or re-creation of the trust fund.

1176.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1176.title: Public Records/Dental Workforce Surveys
1176.description: Provides an exemption from public records requirements for information contained in dental workforce surveys submitted by dentists or dental hygienists to the Department of Health as a condition for license renewal. Provides exceptions to the exemption. Provides for future legislative review and repeal of the exemption under the Open Government Sunset Review Act. Provides a statement of public necessity.

1177.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1177.title: Juvenile Fleeing Law Enforcement Officer
1177.description: Requires the court to revoke, for a period not less than 1 year nor exceeding 5 years, the driver's license of an operator of a motor vehicle adjudicated delinquent for fleeing or attempting to elude a law enforcement officer under specified circumstances. Prohibits the court from suspending, deferring, or withholding an adjudication of delinquency for a juvenile who fled or attempted to elude a law enforcement officer.

1187.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1187.title: Insurance Coverage for Colorectal Cancer Screening
1187.description: Requires certain health insurance policies, health maintenance organization contracts, health insurance programs, group arrangements, and managed health care delivery entities providing coverage to state residents to provide coverage for certain colorectal cancer examinations and laboratory tests for colorectal cancer. Prohibits patients and providers from being required to meet certain requirements to secure coverage, etc.

1188.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1188.title: Civil Citations/Minors
1188.description: Requires the expungement of the nonjudicial arrest record of a minor who successfully completes a civil citation program. Requires the Department of Law Enforcement to expunge the nonjudicial record. Sets forth the conditions that apply in order for the department to expunge the record. Authorizes the department to charge a processing fee.

1189.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1189.title: Gifts/Governmental Entity/Charitable Organizations
1189.description: Deletes a limitation on the amount of time that a gift accepted on behalf of a governmental entity or charitable organization may be retained.

1190.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1190.title: Practice of Optometry
1190.description: Authorizes the Board of Optometry to adopt rules relating to the administration and prescription of oral medications used for the diagnosis and treatment of ocular conditions of the human eye and its appendages. Authorizes certified optometrists to administer and prescribe such oral medications. Requires that a prescription for an oral medication contain the optometrist's prescriber number. Authorizes the board to certify certain applicants to administer and prescribe oral medications, etc.

1191.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1191.title: Insurance Coverage for Cardiovascular Screening
1191.description: Requires individual and group health insurance policies and health maintenance contracts to provide coverage for certain cardiovascular screening tests performed on specified individuals.

1192.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1192.title: Patrol Officers/Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles
1192.description: Repeals provision relating to the assignment of a patrol officer from the Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles to the office of the Governor.

1198.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1198.title: Pretrial Programs
1198.description: Requires each pretrial release program established by ordinance of a county commission, by administrative order of a court, or by any other means in order to assist in the release of a defendant from pretrial custody to conform to the eligibility criteria set forth by the act. Preempts any conflicting local ordinances, orders, or practices. Requires that the defendant satisfy certain eligibility criteria in order to be assigned to a pretrial release program, etc.

1205.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1205.title: Procurement/Preference to Florida Businesses
1205.description: Cites this act as the "Buy Florida Act." Requires an agency, county, municipality, school district, or other political subdivision of the state to grant a specified preference to a vendor located within the state when awarding a contract for printing under certain circumstances. Specifies the percentage of preference to be granted. Deletes a provision to conform to changes made by the act. Expresses legislative intent, etc.

1211.title: Treatment-based Drug Court Programs
1211.description: Requires all offenders sentenced to a postadjudicatory drug court program who are drug court participants and who are the subject of a violation of probation or community control hearing under specified provisions to have the violation of probation or community control heard by the judge presiding over the drug court program. Increases the number of Criminal Punishment Code scoresheet total sentence points that a defendant may have and be eligible for a postadjudicatory treatment-based drug court program, etc.

1213.title: Transition-to-adulthood Services
1213.description: Provides legislative intent concerning transition-to-adulthood services for youth in the custody of the Department of Juvenile Justice (DJJ). Provides for eligibility for services for youth served by the DJJ who are legally in the custody of the Department of Children and Family Services (DCFS). Provides that an adjudication of delinquency does not disqualify a youth in foster care from certain services from the DCFS. Creates the College-Preparatory Boarding Academy Pilot Program for dependent or at-risk students, etc.

1221.last_action: Withdrawn from Criminal Justice; Children, Families, and Elder Affairs; Health Regulation; Budget
1221.title: Elderly Persons
1221.description: Prohibits a court from suspending, deferring, or withholding an adjudication of guilt or imposition of sentence for a person violating certain specified provisions of law. Amends provisions relating to interference with the activities of the State Long-Term Care Ombudsman Program; the licensing of home health agencies and home equipment providers; the property and personal affairs of residents of assisted living facilities; theft from persons 65 years of age or older; abuse, aggravated abuse and neglect of an elderly person or disabled adult, etc.

1222.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1222.title: Physical Education In Public Schools
1222.description: Revises the requirements for waiver of student participation in physical education. Authorizes a waiver through submission of a doctor's note specifying health reasons for nonparticipation.

1224.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1224.title: Retired Justices and Judges
1224.description: Provides for a former justice or judge to be qualified to serve as a retired justice or judge under certain conditions. Provides circumstances under which such justice or judge may not serve as a retired justice or judge.

1227.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1227.title: Assessment of Residential Real Property
1227.description: Prohibits adding the value of certain improvements to the assessed value of certain real property. Provides a limitation on the assessed value of certain real property. Provides procedural requirements and limitations. Requires a nonrefundable filing fee. Specifies additional exceptions to assessments of homestead and nonhomestead property at just value. Repeals provisions relating to the renewable energy source property tax exemption, etc.

1230.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1230.title: Presidential Elections
1230.description: Establishes the Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote. Provides a method by which any state may become a member state. Requires a statewide popular election for President and Vice President of the United States. Establishes a procedure for appointing presidential electors in member states. Provides that the agreement becomes effective upon the occurrence of specified actions. Provides for the withdrawal of a member state, etc.

1231.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1231.title: Florida Retirement System
1231.description: Redefines "special risk member." Revises criteria for membership in the special risk class to include members employed by public acute care hospitals serving certain patients. Provides legislative findings that the act fulfills an important state interest.

1236.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1236.title: Police Dogs
1236.description: Requires law enforcement agencies to provide specified veterinary services, including cremation services, for police dogs that have retired from the agency's service, etc.

1238.last_action: Withdrawn from Community Affairs; Environmental Preservation and Conservation; Budget -SJ 540
1238.title: Working Waterfront Property
1238.description: Specifies property that is eligible for classification as working waterfront property. Authorizes a property appraiser to approve an application that is not filed by a certain deadline due to extenuating circumstances. Requires property owners to notify the property appraiser of changes in use or ownership of property. Imposes a penalty on a property owner who fails to notify the property appraiser of an event resulting in the unlawful or improper classification of property as working waterfront property, etc.

1245.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1245.title: Culpable Negligence
1245.description: Cites this act as the "Officer Jose Somohano Assault Weapons Act." Provides that a person commits a felony of the third degree if he or she stores or leaves an assault weapon within the reach or easy access of another person if that person obtains the weapon and uses it to inflict injury or death. Provides criminal penalties. Provides exceptions, etc.

1246.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1246.title: Prepaid Limited Health Service Organizations/Taxes
1246.description: Provides that an organization providing services solely to Medicaid recipients under a contract with Medicaid is exempt from paying certain insurance premium taxes. Provides for retroactive operation. Specifies that the act is remedial in nature and not a basis for certain refunds of tax.

1247.title: Sales Representative Contracts
1247.description: Repeals a provision relating to sales representative contracts, commissions, requirements, termination of agreements, and civil remedies.

1248.title: Public Lodging Establishments
1248.description: Prohibits local governments from regulating vacation rentals based solely on their classification or use. Provides that public lodging establishments formerly classified as resort condominiums and resort dwellings are classified as vacation rentals. Provides additional penalties for the offense of unlawfully distributing handbills in a public lodging establishment, etc.

1250.title: Florida Endowment for Vocational Rehabilitation
1250.description: Removes a provision that requires the State Board of Administration to invest and reinvest moneys in the endowment fund for the Florida Endowment for Vocational Rehabilitation. Requires that a specified percent of the remainder of all civil penalties received by a county court and after distribution pursuant to ch. 318, F.S., be remitted to the Department of Revenue on a monthly basis, etc.

1251.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1251.title: Supervised Visitation and Exchange Monitoring
1251.description: Adopts state standards for supervised visitation programs. Requires the standards to be published on the website of the Clearinghouse on Supervised Visitation. Provides factors for the court or child-placing agency to consider when referring cases for supervised visitation or exchange monitoring. Specifies training requirements for persons providing such services. Requires supervised visitation programs to conduct security background checks of employees and volunteers, etc.

1252.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1252.title: Water Management District Governing Boards
1252.description: Establishes a water management district governing board nominating commission. Provides criteria for governing board member nominees. Provides for the appointment of commission members by the Governor, the President of the Senate, and the Speaker of the House of Representatives. Provides for terms and duties of commission members. Requires the Executive Office of the Governor to provide administrative support to the commission and to adopt rules, etc.

1254.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1254.title: Medical Expense/Pretrial Detainee/Sentenced Inmate
1254.description: Provides that the responsibility for paying the expenses of medical care, treatment, hospitalization, and transportation for a person who is ill, wounded, or otherwise injured during or as a result of an arrest for a violation of a state law or a county or municipal ordinance is the responsibility of the person receiving the medical care, treatment, hospitalization, or transportation. Removes provisions establishing the order by which medical providers receive reimbursement for the expenses incurred in providing the medical services or transportation, etc.

1269.title: State Memorials
1269.description: Establishes the Florida Veterans' Hall of Fame on the Plaza Level of the Capitol Building. Provides for the Department of Veterans' Affairs to administer the Florida Veterans' Hall of Fame. Authorizes the department to establish a nomination and selection process and an induction ceremony, etc.

1272.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1272.title: Beach Waters
1272.description: Requires a report to the Governor and Legislature by a certain date with certain recommendations. Requires the Department of Health to investigate the sources of contamination of beach waters. Requires the department to develop and implement a public education program regarding human actions that affect the water quality of beach waters.

1273.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1273.title: Creation of Dept. of Health and Human Services
1273.description: Creates the Department of Health and Human Services. Provides for appointment of a Secretary of Health and Human Services by the Governor. Establishes regions for the administration of program services. Establishes program divisions within each region. Establishes the Central Office of Investigative Services. Repeals provisions relating to the Department of Children and Family Services, Agency for Persons with Disabilities, Agency for Health Care Administration, and Department of Health, etc.

1277.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1277.title: Regional Workforce Boards
1277.description: Deletes a repeal date relating to a provision that restricts the use of state and federal funds provided to the boards.

1280.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1280.title: Dentists
1280.description: Prohibits contracts between health insurers and dentists from containing certain fee requirements set by the insurer under certain circumstances. Prohibits a contract from containing a provision that prohibits a dentist from billing a patient the difference between the amount reimbursed by the insurer and the dentist's normal rate for services under certain circumstances. Prohibits contracts between prepaid limited health service organizations and dentists from containing certain fee requirements set by the organization under certain circumstances, etc.

1285.title: Temporary Assistance for Needy Families Program
1285.description: Requires the Department of Children and Family Services to perform a drug test on individuals who apply for benefits funded by the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families Program. Makes individuals responsible for bearing the cost of drug testing. Requires certain notice. Provides procedures for testing and retesting. Provides for notice of local substance abuse programs. Provides conditions for an individual to reapply for temporary assistance for needy families benefits, etc.

1290.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1290.title: Special Health Care Needs/Adolescents/Young Adults
1290.description: Establishes a program within the Division of Children's Medical Services Network in the Department of Health to implement a health care transition program for adolescents and young adults who have special health care needs. Specifies duties of the office with respect to the oversight, implementation, and coordination of the program. Requires that at least one proposed health and transition services program be associated with each of the regions of the Children's Medical Services Network, etc.

1291.title: OGSR/Court Records/Court Monitors/Guardianship
1291.description: Amends provisions relating to public record exemptions for court records relating to court monitors in guardianship proceedings. Consolidates provisions. Provides that orders appointing nonemergency court monitors are exempt rather than confidential and exempt. Provides that only court orders finding no probable cause are confidential and exempt. Saves the exemptions from repeal under the Open Government Sunset Review Act. Removes the scheduled repeal of the exemption.

1292.title: OGSR/Interference With Custody
1292.description: Amends a provision relating to a public records exemption for information submitted to a sheriff or state attorney for the purpose of obtaining immunity from prosecution for the offense of interference with custody. Saves the exemption from repeal under the Open Government Sunset Review Act. Deletes a provision providing for the repeal of the exemption.

1294.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1294.title: Preference In Award of State Contracts
1294.description: Expands provisions that authorize an agency, county, municipality, school district, or other political subdivision of the state to provide preferential consideration to a Florida business in awarding competitively bid contracts to purchase personal property to include the purchase of construction services. Provides that for specified competitive solicitations the authority to grant preference supersedes any local ordinance or regulation that grants preference to specified vendors, etc.

1295.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1295.title: Gambling Devices
1295.description: Creates the "Electronic Machines and Devices for Sweepstakes Prohibited Act." Prohibits operation of an electronic device to conduct a sweepstakes through the use of an entertaining display or to promote such a sweepstakes. Revises conditions for exceptions to provisions relating to drawings by chance conducted by certain organizations. Limits the power of the Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services to adopt rules concerning the operation of game promotions, etc.

1302.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1302.title: Public Employment Practices
1302.description: Prohibits a public employer from inquiring into or considering the criminal history record of an applicant for public employment until the applicant has been selected for an interview by the public employer. Provides that the restriction does not prohibit a public employer from notifying an applicant that a law or the employer's policy may disqualify the applicant from employment in a particular position with the public employer, etc.

1306.title: OGSR/Records/DJJ Employees & Family Members
1306.description: Amends a provision which provides an exemption from public records requirements for identification and location information of certain current and former employees of the Department of Juvenile Justice and their family members. Revises the job classifications specified in the exemption to reflect those classifications used by the department. Removes the scheduled repeal of the exemption.

1314.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1314.title: Enterprise Program Development Zones
1314.description: Cites this act as the "Urban Job Creation Investment Act." Creates the Urban Investment Job Creation Authority. Specifies the duties of the authority to include specifying enterprise program zone boundaries, reviewing applications from businesses to become eligible for certain tax benefits, reviewing proposed projects for eligibility to receive funding from a local enterprise program zone development corporation, and conducting studies and filing reports, etc.

1315.last_action: Indefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration
1315.title: Secondhand Dealers and Secondary Metals Recyclers
1315.description: Defines "appropriate law enforcement official." Clarifies a provision requiring that the secondhand dealers transaction form be delivered to the appropriate law enforcement official. Requires that a secondary metals recycler complete a transaction form and transmit it to the appropriate law enforcement official within 24 hours after the acquisition of regulated metals. Authorizes such recyclers to use an electronic database and transmit transaction forms electronically, etc.

1317.title: Shands Teaching Hospital and Clinics, Inc.
1317.description: Clarifies provisions relating to references to the corporation known as Shands Teaching Hospital and Clinics, Inc. Clarifies provisions regarding the purpose of the corporation. Authorizes the corporation to create corporate subsidiaries and affiliates. Provides that Shands Teaching Hospital and Clinics, Inc., Shands Jacksonville Medical Center, Inc., Shands Jacksonville Healthcare, Inc., and any not-for-profit subsidiary of such entities are instrumentalities of the state for purposes of sovereign immunity.

1321.title: Citizens Property Ins. Corp./Prohibited Activities
